Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: maryannCWellington
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Park Regis for 2 nights and would do so again. While the room was small it was ideal for the two of us. Everything you need is available, staff were helpful and friendly. The 45th floor with arial views of sydney is a highlight. Also loved the dispensers in the bathrooms - what a great idea. Location was fantastic, easy access to the delights of sydney. Would stay again without hesitation, great value for money if your on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than a central back-packers hostel”
Reviews.Author: GJPKEM111
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay for 2 nights, we left immediatly after 1 night. The ONLY positive is the location but there are plenty of other centrally located hotels to choose from. Check-in took forever, we then had to lift our suitcases up 3 or 4 steps to get to the extremely small landing to get an elevator. No porter service at all. We stayed on the 15th floor in a room that was the smallest I have ever stayed in and we've travelled around the world. The room had a soft spongy queen bed and a single bed for our son. My husband complained there was a lump on his side of the bed, well upon stripping the bed linen off we found a large folded cloth sitting on top of the mattress, obviously left there to soak something up from the mattress (!!!!!!) or accidently left by cleaning staff which is very hard to believe. The room had only two low watt ceiling lights which weren't even over the bed so none of us could read in bed as the room was SO dark. I didn't even have a bed-side table. The bathroom could accomodate only one small person at a time, it was the smallest I have ever seen. The soap dispenser fell off the wall when pressed, the shower was marginal and the toilet and sink stained due to age. There is no restaurant in the Park Regis, no bar, no mini bar in rooms, no chilled water in the fridge and the fridge was empty. We paid NZD$275 per night for a standard room and felt absolutely ripped off. We checked out the next morning and checked into the Jamison Amora which is a wonderful hotel and cost us only a few dollars more. There is NO comparison. We will NEVER return to Park Regis and could hardly wait to leave the place. It should be re-named to Park Regis Back Packers and the rate should be 1 third of what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable for the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: kiwicanfly73
Reviews.Content: We choose the hotel for the location and price, the room was clean, serviced well and reasonably sized given the city location. Staff were courteous. There was some road noise even on the 15th floor which could have be improved with better insulation but this is to be expected in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandslondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two occasions during March. We had an executive room each time. There was traffic noise but, as the hotel is in the City centre and on a main road, it's only to be expected. We found the staff on reception extremely helpful and knowledgeable. It is very convenient for Circular Quay and to walk through Hyde Park and the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House, Darling Harbour, King's Cross etc. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Such convenient location you forgive other things”
Reviews.Author: jaybe
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to Hyde Park, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Chinatown, also to buses and trains. My husband and I stayed here before going on a cruise which left from Circular Quay. Other "cruisers" staying at the hotel walked but we hopped on the bus to get to the ship. We were very happy with the room, small but big enough. We were able to make tea and coffee and put "snacks" for breakfast in the fridge - a big saving. We didnt use the pool because of the weather but went up to the roof for the amazing view. Also great being able to do laundry before we went on the cruise. Would definitely stay again. Check out the "hot deals" on the web-site. They have a price at the moment for $103.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay at the Park Regis...!”
Reviews.Author: Willimina
Reviews.Content: I just finished a two night stay at the Park Regis, and in all honesty, I had a great stay there. Having read the previous reviews, I will admit I was a bit apprehensive, but I had no issues at all at the Park Regis. I reviewed lots of hotels in the CBD, and decided to pick the Park Regis because of #1 - the location, and #2- the price, which I found entirely reasonable. I arrived at the hotel about 1/2 hour before check in time, but was advised by the very friendly lady at reception that my room was ready. She reviewed the hotel policies with me, which were all pretty standard, and made sure I had the info I needed to use the elevators. I was pleasantly surprised when I entered my room - it was spic and span clean. I had no troubles with the TV, or the noise from the street. I guess when I am staying in the very heart of a vibrant international city, I expect to hear noise (and in all honesty, the noise was quieter at the Park Regis from the ninth floor than it was when I stayed in Manhattan, and I was not expecting that at all!) The bed and the pillows were clean and comfy, and both nights I had a great sleep. Yes, the bathroom is small, but I wasn't looking at buying the place - and I came to Sydney to see Syndey, not stay in my hotel room or the bathroom! I had no issue with the condition of the bathroom, the towels, or the pressure in the shower. The location of the Park Regis is FANTASTIC! There is a Subway (the fast food restaurant) right next door on one side, and a coffee shop right next door on the other side. There is a Starbucks within 1/2 block on the same side of the street, a Macdonalds within 1/2 block on the other side of the street, and a Woolworths only a one minute walk on the next block over on the same side of the street. The room had a small fridge in it, which thrilled me - I walked to the Woolworths and stocked up on things like water which cost 4 times more elsewhere. Plus, it was nice to have healthy snacks on hand (like being able to pull strawberries out of the fridge!) and seeing as the hotel provided milk and a kettle, I was able to have a cuppa at any point without having to get dressed and go out! Circular Quay is a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel (although be prepared as it takes longer to walk back as the walk back is mostly uphill). Town Hall is within one block, as is the major newly renovated shopping mall (Westfields if I recall correctly). Once I was in the CBD, I did not use a cab once. There is a free transit bus #555 that runs on Elizabeth Street (one block over) from Central Station to Circular Quay regularly. I thought the staff working at reception were lovely - any time I dealt with them they were friendly and efficient. I booked a return shuttle at the airport upon my arrival in Sydney which required a 24 hour notice of pickup time for shuttle back to airport from the hotel - when I asked the fellow at reception if he could help me do that, he was fantastic. There is also a map available at reception which I found very helpful, along with the information the staff at reception gave me. I simply would have no issue staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed up as lamb”
Reviews.Author: rockriva
Reviews.Content: After a long day in the office and an early start the next day I thought I would stay in the city so I could grab an extra hour of sleep. That extra hour never eventuated due to the lack of double glazing...the sirens and yelling were constant, however I was on a low floor. The service was average, the staff need to undertake further training in customer service. I didnt have my frequent flyer card but had the number and the staff member said, "sorry new rule, no card, no points. A moderate makeover with an 80cm LCD TV and some cheap artwork helped bring the room closer to modern day expectations but for close to $200 I would have expected better. The bathroom is tiny which was not a great concern as I was alone, The aircon switch was out of whack meaning the highest speeed was actually "off" and there were no glasses in the cupboard. Handy location however will be looking to others next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not comfortable, Worlds Slowest Elevator's”
Reviews.Author: Barry W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Regis City Centre for 4 nights, the hotel is very convenient to the shopping district and train station, but the rooms are just terrible, Upon walking in and speaking with guest services they were not very friendly, I believe one of the night time staff members was average but thats about it. The rooms were very small and very outdated, there was mould on the bathroom floor and the beds were extremely uncomfortable, the air conditioning had minimal settings so basically it was either on full or off!! not good if you just want light cooling in your room, our key card randomly stopped working on our last night and we had to go down to reception to fix, might I add there was no apology just a swipe and a few taps of the keyboard to get it going. Internet is expensive for wireless connection and the internet in the lobby is $2.50 for 15 minutes, youll even get an unreliable computer that freezes how awesome right?? The house keeping staff barely speak a word of English and use the guest elevators for their laundry service tubs so if your in their way you better move. You need to slam the doors when going out to get them to actually shut, this made me a little concerned as I thought i may wake other guests. There is a roof top pool but it is absolutely pointless along with the area on the roof which you can go out for a smoke but after 10:30 it will be sealed and youll have to go downstairs, the elevators are by far the slowest for a 45 floor hotel, the wait was absolutely incredible (MORE THAN 5 MINUTES) if it sais is going up dont buy it as more than likely your actually going down, I am very dissatisfied with this hotel and would not stay here EVER again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “iPad stolen from my locked room!”
Reviews.Author: ShaxJo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of last year as the hotels I usually stay in we're booked out due to a number of events and conferences in Sydney that weekend. We actually chose the place because the manager responded to feedback on here and we thought that showed respect for patrons and figured we had so much crammed into this one weekend that we would literally only shower and sleep there, so it couldn't be that bad. Man were we wrong! Room was liveable, pretty shabby, but not unhygienic, but probably on par for the usual room rates. I believe looking at the rates now, compared to what we paid, that our rates were jacked up due to the demand for that weekend. The hot water takes ages to heat (probably 20 seconds) and the channel selection on the tv was terrible - all I wanted to see was some Australian News coverage and all I could get was BBC UK! Couldn't even get Sunrise / Today and co, let alone fox news! Location was ok for what we wanted, but it depends where you're planning to go. Worst part was definitely the housekeeping and management. The hallway was filled with the smell of marijuana, and the staff on the desk never appeared interested when it was raised. Rooms weren't made up until late afternoon, which was irritating as the towels are so thin they are saturated after one use, so you throw them on the floor to get changed, come back wanted to shower before dinner and still don't have fresh towels! Worst of all, as I flew straight from work I had my iPad with me. As it was WiFi only it stayed in the room the whole time. We arrived at the hotel at around midnight Friday night and I put it on charge on the desk in the room. Got up early Saturday morning and we were out all day, stopping in for a few 30min - 1 hour blocks and not getting back until probably 1am, the same for the next few days and nights as well. When packing to leave we noticed the iPad was gone, we searched everywhere, nowhere to be found, so we reported it to the front desk and I have never been poorly treated by hotel staff in my life. There was a young man and a woman at the counter and I spoke with the man, advised what had happened and the woman, who was midway through serving another customer started shaking her head and rolling her eyes as I spoke. I asked her if she was alright and she began interrogating us about what we had said asking us rapid fire questions until she became so enraged by our consistent answers that she just barked at us about us not yet reporting it to the police. I explained to the woman that we felt it best, since it was stolen from our locked room and there had been no one in our room but us and their staff, we felt it best to talk to them first, and of course, I wouldn't have had the first clue about the Police station closest to us. I asked them to review their records to see who had been in the room she just said 'yeah we'll get right on that' and laughed. Luckily, the man agreed he would 'look into' it and promised to be there at 4pm to discuss. Upon returning at 4, of course he was no where to be found, and the receptionist tells me he was only rostered until 2! Lucky me, angry woman from the morning was there and I asked her to organise for the manager to call me and explained that we had been to the police and reported it, she started asking for the name of the officer I'd reported it to and I explained that the officers in the station put me on the phone to the reports line, she laughed at me. Next she asked where my 'police card' was and when I said I wasn't sure what she meant she just rolled her eyes. The look of shock as I read the police report number to her out of my phone was priceless, however. Anyway, no call from the manager, so I called them, he said he'd investigate and call back and never did, so I called again and he said he'd asked the staff who said they didn't take it... Gee because they'd admit that, as long as you ask nicely! He then tells me he isn't actually the Manager, he just manages the desk and that the real manager would have to review it to decide if they will accept any liability, wanted any further evidence, ask further questions etc. so I ask when will I hear from him? No... He won't call you, you have to write him a letter! FFS! So I have written him a letter 6 weeks ago, I included a signed statement from myself and my partner about our versions, a statement from the friend who picked us up from the airport who saw me using the iPad to get the address for the hotel, i provided a copy of the original purchase information, a photocopy of the box with the serial number on it and confirmation that I had wiped and locked the iPad. No response, not even an acknowledgement, By the time I'd finally got everything together to send down I'd already replaced the iPad anyway, but it was more the principle, that I hadn't been considered. There are signs in the room saying that if there is a noise complaint they will bill the offender the amount equal to the compensation they pay the complainer (or something to that effect) the fact they would compensate a person for making a noise complaint, but not even acknowledge my complaint is ridiculous. I understand that there are dodgy people out there who probably try to rip them off, but if that was the case, why would I supply proof I owned it, statements from people who saw me with it, and if I still had it, why would I block and lock it! If you aren't going to provide safes, don't hire thieves. If you hire them anyway, at least return people's phone calls or letters. That simple really.

Reviews.Title: “Very average and overpriced, unfriendly staff at front desk”
Reviews.Author: einstein009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bad choice if you are on business travel as I was. It is overpriced, the rooms are incredibly small, also the hallways are extremely small and there were unpleasant smells when I went up to my room. The hotel pool on the roof is kind of nice but pretty useless, I don't think anybody actually uses it. When I went up there to go for a swim in the next morning after my arrival, there were lots of huge dead bugs and insects swimming in the pool, also some food and a newspaper, so obviously nobody takes care of the pool or cleans it (at least this was my experience). I felt disgusted and didn't go into the water. Also, "pool" is a bit overdone, it is more like a larger bathtub, you cannot really swim, because, after one stroke you've crossed the whole "pool" already. This "pool" is probably only installed there to earn more hotel stars or for promotion reasons, but it is actually pretty useless and a bit disgusting. The hotel is not nicely decorated in the interior, the floor carpet looks very cheap, the rooms are extremely basic and VERY small, almost like in a backpackers hostel. There was lots of dust and dirt in the room, I didn't even have space to store away my luggage, and in the bathroom there where fungi on the tiles - DISGUSTING! This hotel is like a better backpacker's hostel but definitely does not have the quality of a a good, decent hotel. I was very disappointed and found the hotel WAY OVERPRICED, considering the quality of the room I had (7th floor with no view at all but to the wall of the neighboring building). Maybe top level rooms are nicer, but that's not the point here, because EVERY room has to meet minimal standards in a hotel when they charge that much for it. The reason why I finally only give one point (=not acceptable) for this disappointing joint is the extremely unfriendliness of staff when I arrived after a 22 hour flight from Europe at around midnight. The clerk at the front was just an idiot, bossing me around and acting in an aggressive manner when I was asking for a better (and, of course, much more expensive and also overpriced) room. I couldn't get another room because, allegedly, the were booked out. Although I had credit card reservation, he said, they thought I would not arrive and that they would have given away my room to the next customer, so I should consider myself lucky to still have a room. WHAT AN IMPUDENCE !!!!! - such an idiot. I've been traveling all around the world, but such a cretin I've never had to greet me at a hotel front desk!! I acknowledge that the clerks on the next days were more friendly and helpful, so you could say, I had bad luck with that person, but I think, such a socially incompetent person should NEVER be in charge at the front desk to begin with. Because of that experience and the overall very bad, disappointing impression this hotel made on me, I can only give one point. The ONLY advantage of this hotel is its convenient location near to downtown, in the middle of business district, but that's all and that is not worth the overpriced rates there. In particular, when I'm on business travel, it is important for me to have a good experience at my hotel, which wasn't the case here at all. I recommend spending even more money for one of the other probably similar overpriced hotels in that area but having a probably much nicer experience and getting more value for your money. All in all I cannot at all recommend this hotel. It's not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: shirley s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location was really good, everything at ur fingertips, the room was way to small, it had a queen bed in it, l have stayed there before with twin beds, that size room was good, so l took my hubby this time he wasnt impressed with the bed touching the walls one step out of bed into the toilet, the room was very clean, pillows were crap, the linen xtremely clean, 2 tiny windows to stick ur head out and look at brick walls on either side, but close to everything in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cant get any better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vicky P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was walking distance to all the major attractions. check in time was 2pm, the reception staff looked after our luggages at no cost as we were there at 10. Our room was the premier king bed on 12th floor. Theres a small window where u can see the traffic below. The bathroom was very basic, no toothbrush! The bed was very comfy. Overall I was really happy with the stay. We paid $135 per night which was alright as we saved lots of time and money with transport around the city. we found a pool on the roof on 45th floor, the view was amazing too.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: GandC1948
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean if a little small and staff friendly and obliging. The main thing was the Hotel is walking distance to everything near the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: AilsaPerth_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews regarding noise and was slightly apprehensive, but we had decided that location was very important to two ladies who are getting on a bit! Yes the noise from the traffic was there but it was more background noise than intrusive and I must agree with Penelope's comments that if you want to stay in a city within a certain budget you have to put up with the drawbacks. The helpfulness of the staff and cleanliness of the room more than made up for the noise. Only negative comment was a slight stale smeel emanating from the bathroom (we suspect the shower curtain/drain) but it was not serious enough for us to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but don't get your hopes up”
Reviews.Author: Ellebana
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel during a spur of the moment trip to Sydney. Having learned that most reasonably priced accommodation was booked out in Sydney that weekend, we felt lucky to find the Park Regis, especially because it is so central and they offered a "park view". On arrival we quickly realised why everyone was staying elsewhere. This hotel is what I would call budget accommodation, even if the price doesn't always reflect that. Our room was comfortable but the building is quite dated. And the street noise was unacceptably loud in the room. The on-site parking is very cramped and we were very glad we had brought our small car - I would not have even attempted to drive our 4WD in there... way too scary and difficult to manouevre without hitting anyone. This hotel may suit those on a tight budget who aren't looking for anything flash but want to be centrally located near Town Hall, Hyde Park and Oxford Street. It definitely wasn't to our taste and I certainly hope that international visitors don't judge Sydney by this place. Hotel management should seriously consider double glazing the windows.

Reviews.Title: “adequate and average”
Reviews.Author: Lokky_78
Reviews.Content: Similar experience as per review by "hydehill". This is my first stay at this hotel and would only stay here again if out of options, which was how I ended up booking into this hotel in the first place (late in organising accoomodation in Sydney for a large international conference). In defence of the hotel, there is a price difference of $300+ dollars per night difference comparied to where I would normally stay, for the period I stayed (price hike due to shortage during the conference). Given the same scenario of late booking and significant (200-300%) price hike at the other hotels I would not hesitate to book this hotel again if there wre no other options. Pros - location. Center of the CBD and close to the monorail. This was for a conference at Darling Harbour. Using the monorail, over a week it never took more than 15min from leaving my room to arriving into the exhibition hall at the Convention Centre; many restaurants nearby; near the Town Hall train station - Comfortable bed. - Internet. Reasonably priced internet with reasonable speed (tested via Speedtest.net: 1.45Mbps upload; .13Mbps upload); Starting at $7:50/hr. Also offers a range of access options to total time (I bought 8 hrs for $30, which was sufficient as I only needed a couple of hours per night) which only counts the time one is online, to blanket full day to multiday access. Cons - Rooms are small (see photo .... the photo of the room was taken right at the corner of the room with an iphone and could not capture much of the bed) - Noisy. Very poor sound insulations from the street (at least when on the 11th floor) Sounds from every car, street sweeper, bus, mono-rail, fire trucks, police cars, etc is heard all through the night - Sydney streets are not quiet in the middle of the night. - Very poor temperature control - see photo. No temperature adjustements, just a fan speed adjustment for the air-con. I found the room to range from cool to too cold. Openning the window helps with controlling the temperature but allows even more noise to come through. - Bathroom needs to be updated. See photo. Soap/shampoo dispenser looks cheap and the products within are below par with other similarly priced hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: hazza55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location - I have stayed here several times over the years. But there are many negatives about this hotel that mean its not top of my list when visiting Sydney - its very much a place I stay only when my favourites aren't available. The negatives start with check-in. Once I finally had the clerk's attention he checked me in and advised that they took payment for the room up front. OK. And they charge a fee for using a credit card - so either go out and find some cash or pay more. Credit cards are the way the world pays when travelling and this practice of charging extra to use credit cards stinks, and it is becoming more widespread. While waiting for the clerk's undivided attention I also noticed the hotel now charges $2 per bag to hold your luggage after checkout. This is something I haven't encountered before, I have always found hotels happy to store your bags if you are not planning to travel until some time after checkout. The vibe I was picking up continued when I got to my room. The room itself was comfortable if somewhat dated - the hotel was one of the earlier additions to Sydney back in the 60s and 70s when more modern hotels started to open. Standard room furniture included queen bed, wardrobe, easy chair, fridge, and a desk/bench with chair. The desk was covered in promotional material trying to get me to spend more - internet, city attractions and the like - lots of those three sided free standing thingys, there were even a couple on my bedside table. I had to put them all in the drawer to make room to actually use the desk. As I said it continued what I felt was a pattern of trying to get whatever they could out of me. The room, being dated, was actually quite noisy despite being on the twelfth floor. But the noise was not just from traffic down below. Being an early riser and early to bed I reckon I clearly heard every other guest on my floor return to their rooms throughout each night I was there. Some of them were probably a bit louder than they should have been but it wasn't like the guests were partying or anything. Lighting in the room was poor, not really enough to be able to read in bed, or not for me anyway. The bathroom was really only just adequate, small with inadequate shelves or towel rail/hooks and with a small shower recess behind a corner curtain. Cleaning was not as good as it could be. I think the bathroom only received one reasonably thorough clean in the three nights I was there. Likewise while the hotel has adopted the idea of soap dispensers rather then providing cakes of soap the dispenser in the shower recess was empty and remained so for my three night stay, So, if you want location and can handle all the negatives this is a good option but for me only at the last minute and if I can get it a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chigga13
Reviews.Content: We found this place to have a great location. We could walk almost everywhere we wanted to. The front desk were very helpful to arrange our rooms earlier then checkin as we had arrived at 9.30am and were in our room by 11am. Rooms were really nice, although they smelled freshly painted and the bathrooms were a bit small and outdated. Would definitely stay here again if we got the $99 a night special or something similar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the city centre. I stayed for business reasons so it was very convenient. Compared to other hotels in the area is was more reasonable priced.The reception area and lifts are small but that really doesnt matter. The staff were pleasant and efficent upon check in and check out. My room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very small but I only stayed a few nights and was by myself so it was fine. I think my room had recently had a refurb because another person I knew stayed on a lower level and her room was different and not as good. So if you going to stay here I was suggest staying in a Park Suite. There was a little noise from the street but it was really not bad considering its in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pack earplugs”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDuke1975
Reviews.Content: Unless you have the ability or desire to wear earplugs to bed every night, DO NOT STAY HERE. windows are barely even single glazed. Sleeping on the 14th floor felt like laying down for a snooze on the sidewalk. Duvet did not have a cover on it, there was some mildew in the (TINY) bathroom, and internet prices are exhorbitant, but the location is very good, and the cost (sans internet) did not break our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Bad value”
Reviews.Author: SkipHopJump
Reviews.Content: The GOOD BITS: The location of this hotel is fantastic - central to the heart of the city. The staff were pleasant and professional and beds comfortable. The BAD BITS: The rooms were small (not too much of an issue for me) however I think the rooms were overpriced. I would expect better facilities in the room for a $200 room! The showers were crap - very difficult to get the water temp to a comfortable temp - either too hot or too cold. The worst thing however was the noise. And I dont mean the traffic noise which there certainly is but that type of noise is expected when staying at a city hotel. The noise that kept me awake sounded like staff vacuuming the corridoors in the middle of the night. It lasted for ages and baffled me why there would be a night cleaner vacumming right outside guests rooms! Not happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but unpleased staff â€“ wouldnâ€™t recommend and will NEVER stay again !!”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Review2309
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no doubt a perfect location. It is a walking distance for all tourist attractions. But unfortunately it is overpriced for the services it has to offer. The rooms are extremely small. Shower area is minuscule and you end up messing the entire bathroom area. Reception is the smallest reception I have ever seen. Usually one relies on concierge and reception to know about the area but it was unfortunate that the reception staff in this hotel was the most unfriendly/ unwelcoming staff I have ever met. Moreover, it seems they were being rascist. To my biggest surprise they donâ€™t have any public restroom at reception, one has to go to next door cafÃ© to use restroom. Also, they charge $2/ bag for left luggage. I heard this for the very first time. Me and my sister carry with us good memories of Sydney to our country but extremely rude, unfriendly and rascist Park Regis hotel staff. So overall only positive about this hotel is its location. Rest it is highly NOT RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Honeybun_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the Executive King room and will not return. I have stayed in many motels/hotels and have had better service than what we received at this hotel. At a motel you will get a biscuit with your tea/coffee. My bed was very uncomfortable and the noise outside and within the hotel was excessive. I did not get to sleep until at least 4am.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep!”
Reviews.Author: DougHales
Reviews.Content: You can always expect a good hotel to have the basics. A comfortable bed, quite environment and excellent service. This hotel will keep you awake until 4am in the morning, at least in the room we had for two out of our three nights. And the room wasn't cheap either. Granted the room was clean and the bed comfortable, but the soundproofing is horrible. They moved us to an inner room for our last night. Although quieter, we still heard traffic that kept us awake. Our reward this poor accommodation was an extra 3.5% charge for the use of our credit card on checkout which was excessive. They were not simpathetic to our plight nor did we receive an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: missuswombat
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints whatsoever about our stay this past weekend. Check in was a breeze, the staff were very nice indeed. We opted to pay $35 for onsite parking, and were lucky to get a spot as December in downtown Sydney is just mental. The hotel is in a perfect spot, right in the middle of town and pretty much in walking distance to everywhere. We had a party to attend at Circular Quay and, though it's about 2kms we walked there in no time at all. Expect to hear some traffic noise. It is, after all, a major city and there are always cars about, no matter the hour. A lot of people have said the rooms are miniscule. These travelers have obviously never stayed in a major city like Tokyo or New York, where you can practically brush your teeth without leaving your bed! A lot of big cities have hotels just like this one - an old building (opened circa 1960) with small rooms that have been renovated. The room was clean, with nice, modern decor and a very comfy bed, great flat screen and high-speed broadband. I didn't find it small - there was even the surprise of a 2nd single bed in addition to our king size bed. We were supplied plenty of linen and towels, spare pillows, and blankets. I was happy to see there was a little bar fridge, as so many hotels have now taken them out to save on electricity costs. It was stocked with milk for tea and coffee, which was welcomed in the morning. There was a sign in the shower saying that water pressure may be an issue, but as we were on the 6th floor this wasn't a problem at all. The bathroom is small, but who cares if you are there for one or two nights. The check-in staff said we could pay in the morning, but as an experienced traveller I opted to pay upon checking in (thus avoiding the mad rush at 10am on Sunday). It was a smart move, the lobby was packed in the morning. We just popped our key into the express box, had breakfast next door at The Coffee Club, and then left the hotel with no dramas at all. I recommend this hotel as it's good value, a great location, and the staff were very friendly and efficient. Don't stay here if you are used to enormous rooms with no sound of traffic. You can go down the road and pay triple the price at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful & Pleasant Reception Staff.”
Reviews.Author: buffie46
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night only, large comfortable bed, bathroom a bit small but all we needed. Nice flatscreen TV. Reception/check in staff very nice (Pablo) we arrived early but were able to get in one room well before check-in & the other room not much after this, Rooms were clean. A lot of street/traffic noise, sirens etc. this is why I rated sleep quality low, not the hotels fault..

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: travellerBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in December and was a little concerned by some of the reviews, but although the bathroom is tiny and the floor does get wet, everything else is well worth the price. Very comfortable beds, plenty of hot water and a brilliant location. If you eat at the Coffee Club next door, be prepared for large portions. I made the mistake of thinking that Nachos would be a snack!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HW82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very Central location which was handy, but the room was tiny and incredibly overpriced. The bathroom facilities were also substandard with very poor water pressure. The bathroom was also tiny with only a shower curtain which meant the entire floor got saturated every time someone had a shower. The lobby area was also tiny which meant checking out was very squashed and the whole place had a very unusual smell. There was also an issue with the doors which meant that we heard the doors of all our neighbours slamming everytime they left which meant our sleep was very disrupted. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central. Convenient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jan C
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Park Regis. Room was small but quite adequate. Very clean with a comfortable bed. Staff were very friendly and helpful and were happy to store our luggage until time to leave for the Airport. Manager put a couple of loose items in his office for safekeeping. Museum station entrance on the next corner, and just a couple of blocks from the Pitt St. Mall. Plenty of places to eat nearby. In fact one on either side of the hotel and McDonald's across the road. Taxi rank directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Quite happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: VK5AKE
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Park Regis and were quite happy with our choice. After reading the comments of other reviewers regarding noise at night I emailed the hotel beforehand and requested a "quiet" room. Staff replied that they would be happy to do so and we were placed at the rear. While we heard the occassional siren we were not bothered by noise at all. Ask for room 1312 if you get a choice. A good size room, very comfortable bed, clean room and bathroom, flat screen TV with Foxtel, toiletries supplied, complimentary newspapers, all right in the heart of the CBD and just over $100 a night. Good value indeed. The view from the 45th floor viewing platform and swimming pool area is great and well worth the lift ride up. My only slight concern was that the lobby is way too small to service a 45 story hotel and it is an obstacle course at checkout time with cases and bags everywhere, but this not a big issue. There is no "inhouse" restaurant but there is a good coffee place next door and many eating places nearby which are open all hours. In summary, not a 5 star hotel but a nice, comfortable, clean place to put your head down right in the centre of the CBD and at a great price. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “2.5/5 due to noise and skimping on room fixtures”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: While the staff that we encountered were uniformly pleasant and the location 100 metres if that from CityRail's Town Hall underground station was superb, on balance I am giving this hotel a '2.' Checkin was fairly quick. However when we arrived at Room 1706, not only was a towel propping open the bar fridge (perhaps due to water leakage), but disconcertingly the bathroom light was inoperable. We went back down to reception: the male staff member immediately offered us an identical room several floors down. We stayed at the hotel on two non-consecutive nights. Friday night was marred by near constant street noise from Park Street, ranging from the usual drunks through to the 0400 bottle collection truck and the 0530 City of Sydney mechanised street sweeper. While not the hotel's fault, the building's former status as the 1968-opened Koala Motel means (or perhaps is an excuse for) the owner not having gone to the expense of double glazing. The airconditioning was quiet: the first bathroom in room 907 that we used had some dirty grout: teh second room (1006) had a spotless, near identical bathroom. Bothn had deterioration around windowsills: in one, it appeared that water from the ancient Dux water 'instantaneous' (actually after running the hot tap for as much as 45 second) hot water and its cold water counterpart was able to find its way behind the tiles. I am no building expert but this cannot be good. The shower and vanity basin both had the old-style palm of hand-controlled dispeners for shaving cream, body lotion, shampoo and conditioner. I last saw these in some reasonably remote Australian country motels. The bathroom tiles were not particularly safe when wet (although not the worst that I have seen). While both beds were comfortable and the properly laundered linen of excellent quality, both rooms only had one bedside table. Lighting in the bedroom was poor, while the psotioning of the power points meant it was hard to connect an IPod charger, the design of which is bulky. A little more thought might have raised the power points two or three centimetres. A good supply of tea, coffee and sugar was on hand while the hotel deserves credit for having installed plasma televisions, albeit with a pretty poor selectrion of channels that compares extremely poorly with the standard offering in say Manila or Singapore CBD hotels. I did not have breakfast on site, but used the expensive Internet ($2.50 for 15 minutes). It was unimpressive to have to pay $2 per stored luggage item. While the object of this charge might partly be to reduce the inevitable high demand that comes with anything free, it was more of an annoyance. Some guests might call it insulting! It would be nice to be able to give this hotel 2.5/5 not 2 but TA's ratings do not so allow. That said, I would avodi this hotel on Friday and probably Saturday nights as well: other nights might be as quiet as the Sunday night on which we stayed. This hotel is part of a building that as far as I know has individually owned apartments (probably suitable for students) so its chance of being demolished is low. That said, the design is (unsurprisingly) 1960s. No paint job or plasma television can make me avoid that sinking feeling that the room suggests I'm in a Moree, NSW country motel not smack bang in the middle of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “DISGRACEFUL”
Reviews.Author: Adrianmob
Reviews.Content: Shocking room. Bathroom looked like a prison and traffic noise constant all night !

Reviews.Title: “Small but good & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IshDewyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a total of 4 nights on a recent business trip and was well pleased with the Park Regis. First off, it was amazingly located. Right in the heart of the CBD, all locations I had to get to was quickly accessible, either by monorail, cab or on foot. I loved the convenience of its location. The room I had was a bit small (it looked exactly like the one in the main picture on top) but it was fabulously clean and well maintained. The workdesk wasn't one of the largest I've come across, but was adequate. Internet connectivity wasn't a problem, except that there was no wifi and you had to plug in the "blue" cable. The only thing I wasn't quite satisfied with was that the bathroom was extremely small and cramped: a tiny sink, tight space for latrine & teeny tiny shower (definitely no bath!) but it too was very, very clean. But I suppose you pay for what you get, and for the price, the small bathroom was a small trade-off for everything else. The service here was excellent. The staff is efficient and things get done with a minimum of fuss. Our entire team built a rather fond friendship with the night manager, Craig, who processed our 3am check-in efficiently and with just the right touch of dry, sarcastic humour. For those looking for a single-occupancy, fuss-free, easy & comfortable place to stay on your business trip, I'd definitely recommend the Park Regis City Centre. For those travelling in larger parties, especially families with young children, perhaps this isn't quite the place for you. The layout of the hotel is somewhat tight (understandable, given that space is a premium in the CBD) which might prove frustrating when you try to manoeuvre prams or other bulky objects. Excellent stay. I would book a room here again on another business trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - must be better hotels there for price”
Reviews.Author: alexander_1984_1984
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings on the hotel. Positives: Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. They gave me an upgraded room (Thank God, who knows what the normal rooms are like if that's the superior room?!), good location - near town hall so good for transport links and 20 minute walk to opera house. Negatives: Room really wasn't great for the price. Cheap fittings (bit like a new travelodge for anyone who's stayed in one from the uk), rooms looked clean - but I have my doubts after I spilled something on the room floor and the stain was still there days later. The duvet on the bed didnt even have a duvet cover on it, instead they had just sandwiched it between two sheets. The bathroom was very small - even far smaller than the one I stayed in Hong Kong well known for small hotel rooms - it didnt even have a proper shower, just a curtain so water went everywhere. Worrying if this is their superior room. the hotel charge you for anything and everything even storing your bags whilst waiting to go to the airport. Conclusion - Bedroom is a glorified travelodge room and the bathroom a glorified university ensuite bathroom. There must be better hotels in Sydney for the price. If not pay the extra and stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “two sisters”
Reviews.Author: Twosisters4
Reviews.Content: the service was good but they told us we would over look hyde park but we didnt you could hear every siren every body screaming we stayed on the 7th floor and you could hear everything and the bathroom was small we either hit the door handle or the hand basin to go in if you were a big person you wouldnt be able to go in the view up on the roof was spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small room, RUDE staff”
Reviews.Author: Robyn-and-Rob
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here and would never come back again. We arrived late afternoon to be told we were in the wrong hotel. Then reception found our booking and still remained rude. The hotel rates more on the lower end of a 2 star which is a pity given its central location. The room was exceptionally small compared to anything we have ever stayed in before.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sunbury42
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average 3 1/2 star room but clean and ideal for overnight stop, noisy but we were after all in city centre! Close to all sightseeing and transport which was our goal. Breakfast extra (deal with coffee house next door) Great affordable meals at Criterion Hotel old Art Deco decor with nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Fine for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: TeamLimaBean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early August. Pros: -Convenient location. It is right in the heart of the CBD. It was within easy walking distance of the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and other points of interest. There are also a number of places close by to get breakfast and snacks (there is a cafe next door and a Woolworth's on the corner). -Clean. The room is beginning to show signs of age and wear, but overall was clean and well-kept. -Nice views from the rooftop patio. The very top floor is an open patio with great views of the city. There is also a small swimming pool. -Good laundry facility. Also on the top floor is a coin-operated laundry room with plenty of good quality washers and dryers. I found this very handy as I ended up doing several loads of laundry. You can buy detergent from the front-desk. Cons: -the room itself was fairly small, and felt a little cramped. -the windows are single paned, and there was no screen. I actually didn't find it too noisy, but I am very used to the sounds of living in a CBD. I have not doubt that others might find it noisy though. -my biggest criticism is the bathroom. It was really small and is a wet-floor style bathroom, which I dislike. The shower was a small awkward triangular shape. Be sure to bring bathroom slippers, as the bathroom floor will inevitably end up soaking wet after each shower. Overall, it was an ok experience. There is nothing luxurious about this place, but it is perfectly adequate for a short stay. Tips: For vegetarian travelers: there is an excellent vegetarian restaurant just a five minute walk from the hotel, around the corner on Pitt Street called "Mother Chu's Vegetarian Kitchen". I recommend the hot pots there--delicious.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect...just train the cleaners please haha”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDM
Reviews.Content: i moved to this hotel after being unhappy with my previous hotel. it was wonderful, which surprised me given some of the reviews on here. the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, modern and nice. they forced you to have the air-con set to heat, which i hated...so i just left it off and left the window open! the bed was lovely and soft and a free paper was a nice touch. it was a 2 min walk to town hall and museum rail stations and close to Pitt St Mall. the ONLY bad thing i encountered was that the cleaners kept putting the clean face washer towells on the toilet! i mean how thick do you have to be to think that is okay? the most basic level of hygiene would tell you not to leave clean towells on a toilet. not a good look. anyway, one minor problem, the rest was great. i'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Bazza76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before catching an early flight the next day. I was a bit concerned having read some of the other reviews but the room was clean & comfortable and of a perfectly acceptable standard. The bathroom was small with shower only but very clean & well presented. Noise seems to be a major factor in many reviews but my room on the 6th floor was quiet & I didn't notice any street noise - my room was located away from the street however. Very easy access to Town Hall station and also a very short walk to Pitt St mall. It was excellent value for the $85 I paid in a Travelzoo promo.

Reviews.Title: “A great place...to avoid"”
Reviews.Author: 255097Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked one night in a "Premier" room on a special promo for $115 a night (very cheap for the CBD, almost too good to be true). Mixed reviews here on TA but we bit the bullet. Reception was where the fun started. They (male and a female) were unfriendly, unsmiling ...both expelled from the charm school I'm sure. They said they were allocating us an "Express Room". Assuming that was a lesser room than "Premier" I said "sorry but I booked a Premier room...I take it there's a difference?" Few sighs from them later, they gave me a room key for a "Premier Room". I asked if it was in a quiet part of the hotel (early flight next day)...they said "no, it's next to the lifts." I then said I'd asked for a quiet room on my booking...they said I hadn't and the hotel was full. Luckily I had my print-out to show them of the booking confirmation with "quiet room" request and suggested they could be helpful and switch rooms as it was early afternoon. More grunts, sighs and body language later they gave me a different key, made me pay in advance and no smiles or thank you. We did though, but not them. Room; double bed, one chair, one bedside lamp. Bed was comfy enough, carpet was grubby and stained, windows filthy, bathroom was miniscule and a touch grotty. Sporadic and loud noise of traffic and endless sirens all night, even though 11 floors up. So much for the quiet room! If these were "premier rooms" (and it was, I checked with the cleaner) then they need detonating.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if you are paying with credit card. I do not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjlc65
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel rooms are very small, no hotel lobby to sit and chat with friends. Hotel staff unprofessional. First they rung up the wrong payment for two rooms, double the fee of what I booked online. They fixed it, but the refund would not be registered to my credit card five to six business days. I was travelling around australia, and staying at other hotels, and that was a great inconvenience due to risk of going over credit limit and possibly card being rejected. Another problem, the hotel charged me for total fee, including the booking fee, which later the booking company CentralR.com charges me again. I would be very careful I stayed in another hotel upon returning to Sydney from other cities in Australia, Holiday Inn, for nearly same price, Much Better service, better value, better rooms... Most importantly, No hassels with inappropriate charges.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible sleep”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide_man
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central location and has Ok rooms. However, the management have made the very foolish decision to set the air-conditioners in the rooms to the same temperature for everyone. Both I and others I knew staying at the hotel wanted some cool air and all we could get was hot air. We had to open the windows to keep cool and it was very noisy will sirens, shouting and car noises all night. There are no bed-lamps on one side of the bed, the showers are awful (low pressure and difficult to regulate), no break-fast room or proper foyer. Recommendation: change the Air-Cons to cool all year round! The rooms are warm anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mel1711
Reviews.Content: Great location, really close to shopping, tourist attractions etc. Originally had a standard room which was tiny, upgraded to a premier suite which was well worth it. Bathroom not the best, but did the job. Was clean & tidy. Yes there's traffic noise but it's in the middle of the CBD so expected, still slept well. Staff is extremely helpful & friendly, big thank you to Pablo for getting me my room early after a red eye flight and then being super nice about the upgrade. For the price I got through travelzoo & location would def recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Anne500
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews about this hotel I was wondering what it would be like. It was fantastic. It was close to all the amenities and services I needed, train station, bus stops, supermarket, the new Westfield. The staff were friendly and courteous and the room was just fine. It was modern and comfortable. The bathroom was on the small size but no smaller than many of the hotels I have stayed in. Getting hot water was a little challenging but was worked out in the end. (Don't turn the hot tap all the way around). I wouldn't stay here is you want complete quiet but I love the sounds of a city, the odd siren and the treat of fireworks one night.. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and it was absolute value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandyjane84
Reviews.Content: Could not complain about the hotel, it was very clean, central and close to coffee and resturants, as well as 2 blocks from Pitt st mall, and entertainment. We walked everywhere. Staff all nice and knew great places to eat and drink. Room for 2 people was fine. Great value

Reviews.Title: “No sleep because of road traffic”
Reviews.Author: BBbbBbe
Reviews.Content: Hotel on busy road. Unable to sleep due to noise from road. Management declined a request for a different room. Forced to find new hotel to get some sleep. I would avoid this hotel at all costs ... Unless you don't need sleep.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic place to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: chrissie045
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. Right in the centre of Sydney. Beautiful views from roof. We got up to watch the sun rise. Got some fab photos of Sydney. The bed was very comfortable. The room was compact but fine. Shower was excellent. Very clean. Could watch TV fro bed. The staff were great. Very efficient. We got a 1/2 price deal through Travelzoo. It was so worth it. Will definitely stay there again and I would be happy to try their other hotels because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mowzi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Park Regis hotel located on Park Street Sydney. We booked this hotel mainly because it offered a great rate of $159 per night, which I thought was great for being so close to all amenities. Booking in was great, the guy that booked us in was very well mannered and a pleasure to deal with. We stayed in room 1407, the room was clean and tidy, but the bathroom very small. Only let down was the noise, we were on the 14th floor and we could still hear people talking on the street. The road noise is unbelievable even with all windows closed and curtains pulled across (which don't block out enough light) nothing helped. I suggest that you take ear plugs with you if you want to get any sleep. They need to address this, as its a major issue. Either by double glazed windows or noise absorbing furnishings. I would probably stay again, but I would be well equipped with my ear plugs

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights with my friends. The location is very convenient. The staff at the reception was friendly and understanding. They upgraded us to a better room and provided great info about the tourist attractions in the city. Also, recommended us a great restaurant. The room was modern and bed was comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Want no Sleep stay in a Premium room”
Reviews.Author: grub08
Reviews.Content: Room 703 was terrible it had so many faults. The shower was scolding one minute & if you tried to add a small amount of cold it was the opposite (as directed by a plaque). The toilet Cistern was inadequate.. paper remained & refill was a waiting game 2nd flush was touch n go. The bed was 2 singles made into a king & one side was no better than a fold out camp bed. The street noise was not dampened by the curtains the old glass paned windows traffic/pedestrian sounds all night. The lift which was situated outside the paper thin door ran continual. When in the hallway/room you could hear the conversations within the other rooms. (I did ask for a room away from the lifts & booking was "WELL" in advance). I was advised that Motel was subject to availability heavily booked at the same time.( to believe or not to). The Park Regis does have it plus the top floor has a pool and seating area with a 360* view of Sydney.( a must if you stay). The motel is well situated in the CBD and easy walking to the Museum & Art gallery. A grocery store Woolworths is close by. If I was to stay at the Park Regis I certainly would not stay in a premium room Noisy, old , very narrow room. That is in dire need of its amenities repaired & replaced. I have corresponded with management and he assure that all issues would be addressed. Parking within is very tight

Reviews.Title: “Great price for great location”
Reviews.Author: ThorntonsTwo
Reviews.Content: This was a 'sleep only' booking as we were on a sightseeing mission, and this hotel is great for that. The poky reception and ancient lifts aren't very promising, but then the room was fine, if on the small side. Very clean and a great, king-sized, comfortable bed. Awesome location. We were on the 13th floor and it was quite noisy even up there, but not too bad. We were hardly there as only in Sydney for 3 days, so it was perfect for a good central location and a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: shelly1972
Reviews.Content: a great location for a solo traveller. just 3mins walk to town hall train station & only a 2 minute walk to the monorail. there a a big supermarket just down the street & the hotel was within walking distance to the sydney bridge, opera house & the beautiful rocks area. the hotel also had a pool on the roof & a 360 degree observation deck on the roof top & the views at night were spectacular! my room was immaculate & cleaned / serviced daily. the reception staff were very friendly & extremely helpfull on sight seeing ideas & how to get around. after my checkout i paid $2 to have my luggage safely stored while i went to the rocks markets & then returned to the hotel to meet my booked shuttle. the only negative thing i overheard was another visitor complaining about the extremely tiny shower which was in a small corner space. YES it was the smallest shower ive ever seen, but it was fine (almost cute) & the shower pressure was fantastic. no kitchenette to cook anything, however there was a fridge & kettle with tea, coffee & milk supplies

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, poor service, dirty, broken light awful place”
Reviews.Author: louey3
Reviews.Content: these aparments are awful - tiny, poorly maintained, staff were rude, sorting out the possibility of being charged twice, no tea or coffee and no hot waer! poor value. dont stay here. Charged $2 per bag to store bags for a couple of hours

Reviews.Title: “Come again? I dont think so....”
Reviews.Author: paisleybikini
Reviews.Content: Picked this place based on the location and price, thankfully - the location was the only saving grace, right by Town Hall Train station. Cleanliness was AWFUL. There was un-identified muck on the floor, the bathroom was tiny, the shower was like not quite over the toilet - reminded me of being on a ship! The fittings were loose and one broke, smashing my toiletries bag to the floor. The room was tiny but the bed was comfortable. The service was fine. I did get some helpful advice from a younger member of staff when asking how to pre-purchase travel tickets. I thought this place was over priced for what you got and certainly needs to invest in a serious upgrade of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tcgh
Reviews.Content: Shocking service - and that was from the manager. Most staff weren't much better, for example I asked for a shuttle bus booking to the airport and they said it was impossible without 24hrs notice!! "Try a cab or a train"... Not to mention very small rooms, and I had the apparently luxurious park suit! Don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, just okay!”
Reviews.Author: Meags4273
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Twin room at the Hotel with a friend this past weekend. The location is terrific, right in the centre of Sydney with public transport everywhere around it. Walking distance to everything in the City. The beds were comfortable enough and the rooms were on the smaller side, but definitely big enough. My one issue with the Hotel is the bathroom. It's a bit on the smaller side, which wasn't a huge issue but the problem I had was with the water temperature in the shower - it was either scolding hot or freezing cold and could not be regulated. You can deal with it if you are there for 3 nights but if you were staying there for an extended period, it would be a huge annoyance. That is really the worst thing I have to say about the Hotel, I found the security great and the staff at the front desk more than helpful. The rooftop area was great and I just wish it was a little warmer to have taken advantage of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerthWA
Reviews.Content: On arrival we started checking in with one receptionist who abandoned dealing with us (without explanation) and passed us on to a colleague (Pablo - who was friendly and great throughout our stay). Our 6th floor room was bleak, walls and skirting boards marked and dirty, the air con extremely noisy and not working, the room was small and the en-suite even smaller, the beds were really hard and lumpy, the lamp insufficient and dusty, the window small and high with a view of nothing but a small car park, the hair dryer quickly stopped working until it cooled down again, etc. The corridors were really narrow and everything felt neglected and very basic. None of the images on the website looked at all like our room. On our way out, I mentioned to another receptionist that the air con didn't seem to be working in our room and he said he could move us to a different room but we would then only complain again about something else. Blimey! I said that sounded a bit rude and not great customer care but he just shrugged. I then asked if we could have a spare duvet to put under the sheet to lie on as the bed was really hard and he said he would arrange it (which he didn't until I asked again about 5 hours later at bedtime). There were no mattress toppers/protectors on the beds (so the sheet is directly on top of the mattress - not super hygienic) and we were advised later that this is because they were single beds and they can't get toppers for these!! On our last morning we had a 12 noon check out but were woken at 7.10 am with the loudest noise - which sounded like a helicopter in the bedroom and lasted over 10 minutes. It was as loud in the corridor and I rang reception who could hear it too. We were later advised that this is a monthly test in the apartment block in the same building and should not be done until after 9 am. We asked to speak with the manager as we were leaving and explained what had happened. He promised to check out our issues and refunded approximately 10% of our stay. He advised that he had heard my comment upon arrival about the poor customer service and had asked the receptionist what the issue was after we had gone but been told it had been sorted out. I think that a manager hearing a customer saying that the customer service is not very good, should intervene immediately to try to remedy the situation. He also advised that the beds had not been replaced for 5 years but had not received any complaints which he had been surprised about as he would imagine that beds needed replacing every 3 years. But why wait until guests complain before replacing them? The report of the air con not working had never been noted by the receptionist and therefore no maintenance was requested. I appreciate that this is only a 3.5 star hotel but we still left disappointed and would not recommend this hotel for a stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: jimshoes26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 13 nights for business. The location was perfect. As for the room, it was on the smaller side but still adequate. However, the bathroom was really tiny and just like everyone else talks about is the shower. When I read reviews about the shower I blew them off, however there is a weird angle to the shower and the sink is small. Small things you notice when you travel. Other than that, a great place to stay. Pablo at the front desk was very friendly and always helpful. Cheers Pablo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Fine for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: kattillac
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the staff were friendly, and check in didnt take long. They staff could have explained how to use the lifts, although it was easy enough to figure out, it would have been nice to be told to begin with. When we arrived in our room, we had 2 single beds instead of a queen/king and the room smelt like vomit. Reception was happy to send a cleaner up to join the beds for us. We thought it would be uncomfortable, but they joined them, had a cover on top, a duck down layer on top of that, and then the sheets etc. The bed was surprisingly comfy for joined singles!! The doona was luxurious and soft! The smell on the other hand, we figured out it was spilt milk that hadnt been cleaned out of the carpet very well. We just left the window open most of the time so whenever we returned we didnt get hit with a wall of vomit smell. The bathroom was failry small, but definitely big enough for 2 nights. However it was not very well cleaned. Lots of different colours/types/lengths of hair in the corners and over the floor. And there was shaving cream or similar on the inside of the shower curtain from the last guest. The shower curtain likes to join you in the shower, quite annoying but like any other shower curtain! I saw a couple of reviews complaining about the water temperature, but our room actually had a plaque on 'how to' use the shower so that you didnt burn and freeze, so that wasnt a problem. We had a 'Do not Disturb' sign on our door, as we didnt feel we needed our room serviced daily. When we returned from our day out, there was a plastic bag at our door with fresh towels and bath mats in it. The rooftop leisure area was quite nice. Not much around the pool but the sun room type level was great. And let you look out over the whole city. It's a shame you couldnt see the harbour bridge or Opera house though, but was still quite nice, and fresh. The hotel is on a busy street, so there was a fair amount of noise (sirens, horns, cars, people) straight out the window, but it is after all a city. So not a big surprise. GREAT location, a block from Woolies, and town hall station. Down the road from Pitt St, and close to numerous pubs/eateries/etc. I managed to book this for a discounted rate, which I was happy with (for sydney prices) and got 12pm checkout free of charge. That was a definite plus, as our flight was 1pm. So we didnt have to rush or get a cab anywhere, we could take our time getting to the train and airport. All in all, I would stay again, and hopefully wouldnt smell like rotten milk/vomit again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: martine088
Reviews.Content: All in all I was satisfied with my stay at the Park Regis. The location is excellent as it is in close proximity to the subway and to some main attractions on the city. If I recall, it was only a 20-25 minutes walk to the Sydney Habour from the hotel. There's a also a Woolworth's down the street from the hotel, which was quite convenient.The room was standard and well cleaned on a daily basis. The hotel has a nice rooftop patio that offers a great view of the city. The hotel also holds your luggage at no extra cost if you arrive before official check-in time and your room is not ready. I thought the hotel offered good value for what we paid and would recommend it to budget conscious travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, less than average room”
Reviews.Author: bellipoppergirl
Reviews.Content: Overall: This is really a budget hotel that represents itself as more. Don't be fooled by the 'discount' prices, no matter where we looked the average price was 1/2 what the 'usual' price was. We wish that we had stayed somewhere else. Cons: The room was very small, the bathroom was tiny. The bed was very uncomfortable - the king we requested was simply two singles pushed together. The add-ons of the deal we opted for were not provided (ice-cream on arrival, and newspaper). Bathroom not well cleaned. Pros: The location was great- within walking distance of everywhere, and 1/2 a block from the entrance to the airport train. Friendly service. The hotel held our baggage after checkout for a minimal fee.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MartinclanTauranga
Reviews.Content: First impression was walls were painted but skirting boards had been ignored and on shutting the door saw behind it had not been vacuumed for a while. Appreciated the attempt to upgrade the bathroom with a new basin but was horrified to see previous guests pubic hair on the floor tiles and grubby dispensers. Bedside cabinet on one side of the bed only with a lamp not strong enough to read by, curtains not wide enough to cover the whole window area (meet in the middle with a gap at one end or cover the ends and not meet in the middle). Went to make a cup of tea and found the dusty jug obviously not used or cleaned in a while and was just left feeling the whole room was grubby. How hard can it be to fix the water pressure problem if you really want to offer guests a good experience and training housekeeping staff to a high standard is not impossible.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here overnight on a Saturday night. Room is quite small but we didn't expect much considering we only paid $115 for the night with the Travelzoo special. Didn't realise we had to request a twin room in advance so we got a King room on the 8th floor. Thought we would have trouble sleeping as the traffic noise was clearly audible when we first walked into the room but the air con noise drowned out the traffic noise and we both slept well until sunlight started to filter into the room. Unfortunately, the curtains were about 40cm too short and did not fully cover the width of the window. They put the wardrobe next to the window in an attempt to cover up that part of the window but there was a space of about 20cm above the wardrobe that was not covered. Hence, we both woke up at around 9am after getting back to our room at 2:30am. Not good considering we had a late check-out of 12pm. The shower was a weird triangular shape so I had to adjust the shower head, but this meant the bathroom floor was drenched as there is no shower door, only a shower curtain. Check-in and check-out was smooth albeit slow. They charge a surchage if paying by credit card and there is a $30 charge for parking. There is a Coffee Club and Subway next door. Good hotel if you're on a budget but not ideal if you're planning on staying for longer than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations,Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from Dec 28th 2010. Check in was quick and efficient and staff friendly and polite. Room was on the small side but as we were only there for 3 nts it was adequate for our needs. Small compact bathroom with good shower,tea/coffee making facilities.We were on the 16th floor,quite high up,cannot say that we had a prob with road/traffic noise as per other reviews,we actually experienced a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed. Nice rooftop terrace and pool area,we didn't get to use it,but had we stayed longer maybe we would have.This hotel really is in a great location,only couple of mins walk to shops/bars/restaurants/mono-rail and approx a 10 mins walk/stroll to Darling Harbour and across the road from Hyde Park.Would we recommend-Yes,Would we stay again-Yes. Had we wanted a better class of hotel then we would have paid more,we got what we paid for and were more than happy with our choice. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: allanm09
Reviews.Content: Park Regis Premier Room Premier twin room booked via hotels.com from the uk based on the published pictures and information plus some favourable reviews on trip advisor (neither of whom can be held responsible for any disparities) This is possibly the worst accomodation and poor value in this price range that I have encountered in years of travelling. On arrival, the reception looks fine if a little tiny. Two busy, presentable and polite receptionists. The problem is what lies behind the reception: narrow corridors leading to small, noisy, depressing rooms with tired decor and spartan furnishings; overall the impression is that the place is grubby and nothing like the published pictures - I really should have taken some pictures to back this up. The first room we were given was small and noisy - the windows faced onto hyde park and the busy main roads that border it; the windows were dirty and one window didn't close properly - which added to the noise - it wouldn't have been a quiet room even with the window closed. We took the matter up with reception - after a considerable wait, having had to rejoin the check-in queue, another room was found for us after some persistence. Though quieter than the first room and slightly larger, it only had a small high slit window and so lacked much natural light - same depressing tired decor as the first room. The bathroom consisted of a cramped toilet and shower. It does not have any of the facilities that one has come to expect in this price range - bar, restaurant, etc. note that many favourable reviews emphasise its proximity to such amenities - to be honest, I have no idea why others give this place such high ratings - but that's their prerogative. We found it to be so bare, cramped, grubby and depressing that we checked out having paid for one night and found accomodation nearby at the Menzies hotel - suffice to say that this is a large, spacious hotel in an excellent, central location with bars, restaurants, a large indoor swimming pool, gymnasium etc. etc; the room was huge, well furnished and clean - and Â£20 per night cheaper than the Park Regis. I note that comments similar to my own go way back over some time yet the responses from the management of this establishment to such criticisms are nothing more than a formulaic whitewash presumably aimed at reassuring prospective customers. This is undoubtably the most negative review I have ever written; as such, I should point out that I have absolutely no connection with the Park Regis (or the Menzies for that matter); I'm simply reporting my experience of the Park Regis, its Premier room and how it compares with other establishments near by.

Reviews.Title: “Park Regis City Centre is not a Hotel nor a Motel”
Reviews.Author: scott_p14
Reviews.Content: The Park Regis City Centre is not a Hotel nor is it a Motel or Travelodge. there are no facilities e.g. Bar , Breakfast room or Restaurant . They do offer Breakfast but this is located next door in a private cafe. Reception is small only 1 member of staff serving. The rooms are small , and not very clean. the windows are very old and do not shut correctly , therefore you can hear the busy road below all night long. The pool is shared with private apartments within the same tower block. there are proper Hotels in walking distance that are cheaper and offer everything you expect from a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location! Good value!”
Reviews.Author: fonduekat
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Fantastic location, very central. Coffee shop downstairs, meters from Monorail, and train station also closeby. Supermarket on next block, so easy to get all of the essentials without trecking all over the city. NOISE: Others have commented on noise being an issue, particularly at night. While we did hear some noise, it was not excessive, and we were able to sleep without any problems. Found it best to have the window completely closed, as made a huge difference. FACILITIES: We booked a "family room", which was one room with a King bed and Single bed. While not a lot of space in the room, it was still comfortable, and we survived the 5 days without getting on each others nerves. Our bathroom was small, but not too cramped. Each room seemed to have a different bathroom configuration, so I guess it depended on which room you were allocated. Room had all necessary facilities - iron, board, hairdryer, tv, mini fridge, kettle etc. Roof top deck offered fantastic views, and a great place to relax. Pool good, although water was quite cold due to it being quite windy up on the 45th floor.
