VALUE: We stayed in the Park Regis in the days leading up to and including New Years Eve, so did pay more than the usual rates, however when compared to other hotel rates for the same period, Park Regis was still good value. This is the second time that I have stayed at the Park Regis, and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An ok stay but wouldn't go back unless the price dropped dramatically”
Reviews.Author: Miss76
Reviews.Content: Arrived midday and was able to check in early which was great, only one lift key issued per room which can be an issue if two people want to re-enter separately. Room small, only one bedside table and wardrobe had an overpowering smell of cleaner which contaminated anything in it which made hanging clothes around the room interesting! bathroom ridiculously small with no external window which isnt often an issue, however, the shower was "stuffed" into the corner of the bathroom in a triangular space which made cleaning very interesting. always hot water though which was good. The room was conviently located so getting to and from anywhere was not an issue - we arrived by airport shuttle which was an experience in itelf but cheap and you get an additional discount if you book online in advance. The rooms do not have air con which i dont recall being noted anywhere and there is no double glazing on the windows and so noise at nights gets very loud, beware. Another thing to note is that they charge $2 per bag to hold your luggage - i think this is the only hotel i have travelled to which have charged this, which seems unneccessary. On a plus note the roof top pool area and decking is lovely, great views and clean with good comfortable furniture to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Would not change anything about my stay at Park Regis City Centre”
Reviews.Author: HopeJane
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of this hotel I was a little unsure of what to expect but now that I have experienced it, I wouldn't have worried at all. We stayed at Park Regis City Centre for 4 nights 5 days for my boyfriends formal and I wanted it to be perfect. It was :) The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was premier twin beds, surprisingly it was spacious and modern. We stayed on the 10th level, our room was not noisy at all, we slept every night perfectly. There were a few sirens through the night but nothing that could keep you awake. Our windows could be opened or closed and we enjoyed our views of the city and Sydney Tower. We had an air conditioning which could be set at any temperature desired. We loved the LCD flat screen tv, It was nice to relax after our big days with some good movies and tv shows that were on. The only things that i least liked were, the shower curtain blows in on you because it's an open shower and a few loose knobs but those didnt bother us. The rooms were very clean and room service came every day to clean up our room and were happy to bring us clean towls etc. Didn't get to use the roof top pool, was a little chilly up there but the veiws up there were something special. The location was amazing, very close to everything. Didn't need to worry about transport, there were taxis all down the street. Woolworths just a short walk, everything we needed was just down the road. During our stay we went to Jamberoo Water Park, Sydney Aquariam, Darling Harbour, China Town, Paddys Market, Market City and more. I would recommend all of them, so much fun. Overall our stay was great, I would stay at this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE VALUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi9999
Reviews.Content: I do not intend to stay at Park Regis again - cleanliness was below average. It was noticed the lifts and the corridors were not vaccummed - unhygenic. Dusting was not done properly, checked thecleanliness in the room was again way below average. It felt like a box and the bathroom is so tiny - more for asian size! I will not be recommending this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures didn't reflect the truth”
Reviews.Author: BauBauBau
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed about the stay here. When you look at the pictures of the hotel, you will find that it looks really nice, but it's not the truth! The room is extremely small and dark instead of bright from the pictures. The interior decoration is so old that, air-conditioner switch is very old school and not working with very strange noise. The tiles in the bathroom are broken and no towels provided on the first day when I stayed. The wall and the door of the rooms are so thin that, you could actually hear what the people next door was talking about and whenever there's someone on the doorway, you can hear what they said as well. This makes me feel no privacy at all! Hotel should provide the privacy and should spend some money to renovate the rooms!!!!!!! The check out time is unexpectedly early (10:00a.m.) as most of the hotels I stayed before, the check out time should be at least 11:00a.m. and the most ridiculous thing is that if you would like to request for a late check out, you need to pay extra $30-40 (I forgot the exact amount as I do not expect to pay for this) and I think that the hotel needs their staff the clean up the room but didn't employ enough staff to do so, so kick the guest out earlier and give them more time to clean up!!!! Plus, after you check out, if you would like to keep the baggage at the hotel, you need to pay for that as well, $2 per baggage. I had never stay in anyone of the hotel that I need to pay for these things after I had paid for the past few days!!!! This is ridiculous and actually rip-off!!!!You need to pay $2.5 for the internet service but you could only use 15 mins whereas you could use internet service at the World Square for $2.5 per hour! This is another rip-off!!!! I am so disappointed about the stay and would not recommend anyone there unless the hotel would like to spend more money to improve the problems!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The smalles room ever!”
Reviews.Author: Monicaloo
Reviews.Content: I book a tripe room but instead they give me one doble and the put a kind of bed to make "triple" the room which was quite small, the bath doesn't have any ventilation, and i felt like i was in a cage! the room was not pretty in shape, the shawer was broken and it took 3 days to fix it! Also when i try to get a shower the bath was a mess! water everywhere! i might say that the only good side of this hotel is that is in the city center, but the service was not quite good. They do have parking but if you have a van, there is no way that you can park there, the height is 1.90, and there is no way that you can fit in there, also if you want to park there they charge you AU$30dlls! which is a madness, i will recomend if you need to park do it in the street way much cheaper but very complicated!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: trawellguru
Reviews.Content: Great location close to all the major sights, clean and safe for solo travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveller012
Reviews.Content: Good location. The room was a decent size, but the bathroom was a really odd shape. I definitely don't recommend this place if you want to get some sleep! The AC is inefficient and the room in incredibly dark. No wireless internet and no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Suggest you look elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: kineticbeat
Reviews.Content: Small, awkward room in need of maintenance and a good clean! Short sheeted on a sprung mattress Definately don't bother springing for a 'Premier' room

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value”
Reviews.Author: Stephen96
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights. Quiet, clean, business-like room with 3 single beds on 8th floor with NE view. Priced like motel with special. Near Hyde Park, walking distance to Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay ferries, opera house, bridge. Great view from 45th floor rooftop (didn't try pool).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Liley_7
Reviews.Content: From the beginning the parking was easy to find and easy to get in, however once in there, there are very many tight spaces and the parking lot was awkward, so be careful if you have a new or expensive car. Reception was busy upon check in but was friendly, helpful and obliging. I was only there for one night and it suited its purpose for the location and price. The room was fairly clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are very small and dated, the shower doesn't block all the water so you'll end up with a wet bathroom every time you shower. Only downfall was you could not have a hot shower due to water pressure/saving and the shower could only be luke warm at the best of times. Overall, would stay there again if it were only an overnight stay, would not stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and small but great location”
Reviews.Author: BaldBuddha
Reviews.Content: The price in relation to the location of this hotel kinda but not quite made up for the noise, the claustrophobic hallway and the tiny dated bathroom. It was impossible to sleep without earplugs because of the traffic noise all night long. AC only produced hot air. The location was A+ though. All the major sites within walking distance and plenty of eating opportunities right around the corner. Oh, and do check out the view from the 45th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly this hotel is tired. We recommend you look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: rekrabd
Reviews.Content: Our room was worn out with too many faults to list here. It could not be rated at 31/2 stars in comparison to hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for city stay at sensible price...”
Reviews.Author: paulwil244
Reviews.Content: Central location, with extremely helpful and knowledgable reception staff. Spotlessly clean and spacious room; bathroom a touch small but perfectly adequate. Emailed ahead to ask if early check in would be possible and they obliged (8am). Downsides: bottled water in room $5 and expensive internet. No restaurant onsite but situated in the middle of plenty of eating options. Airport shuttle available at $12 each so wouldn't bother doing the train/bus alternative again as I did when I arrived. Check out the free roof top views (45th floor) inc pool and conservatory area-WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but no Air-conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: muendo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely centrally located. Rooms & bathrooms are clean. We stayed here last week when the weather in Sydney was hot. There is one problem however. No air-conditioning. Its a central system where it works as a heater during winter and a cooler during summer so there is no way for you to change it from your room. So we had to keep the window open and be completely disturbed by the drunkards, fire brigade & police sirens who do pass by every 15 mins! so my advice is if this hotel improves its air conditioning system, it is great. if not there is a big problem. it was really hot at night!

Reviews.Title: “Very centrally located, excellent for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Mypo
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very accommodating, Room small but clean and met our needs. We were on the 7th Floor so road/street noise was an issue for most of the night getting worse as the business day started. The hotel was easy to get to by Taxi in the evening and was very well located for us to attend our Visa appoitment the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Location, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mi33-Review
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Park Regis City Centre on the 10th August for 1 night. I stayed in a Park Suite room 1202, which everything I seen in the pictures on the website was exactly what I got and that was in a good way of course. Close to public transport, many places to eat and shops etc. The Room was very modern, king size bed (which is 2 singles put together) but with saying that theres no gap in the middle. I loved the tinted mirror wall behind the bed. The Windows in the bedroom could not be opened though as there is another piece of glass with a border around it, so not sure why this is. curtains within the room blocked most of the light out at night which is always a good thing, could hear the traffic quite a bit but thats like more hotels within the city. Not much lighting must say, although there are 2 lamps in the bedroom and a light at the desk there isn't an actual light within the bedroom so felt kind of dark even during the day. Mirror near the Door was a nice touch, it's always a good thing to see before your heading out. Bathroom is small, but is very modern, Shower was nice and hot, There are a few scuff marks on the walls, and walls that appear to have been patched up then painted over. Small bar fridge, coffee making facilites although Gloria Jeans is across the road. Woolworths is just down the road as well which is always good if you've forgotten to bring something with you. A bed head on the bed would of been nice also especially when your getting your freak on ... Both Televisions worked, the Aircon/heating was hard to work out how to use the remote (maybe a card near by to show which buttons to push its hard especially when your not used to using them. I was located next to the Lift, so was a little bit annoying at times. Lounge area was comfy so was the chair at the desk in the bedroom. The Bed was also very comfortable Was a good night stay, if you're looking for a decent hotel within the city, close to everything choose this one. I had reed the reviews on here from other people and was cringing to what I had reed but staying here now changed the way I may have thought bout staying here. Staff at reception where very nice also

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Hastatus
Reviews.Content: My significant other and myself stayed here towards the end of May 2010. No romantic or other special treat - it was just for weekend accommodation whilst attending a conference, so there were no great expectations. We liked the location as it was pretty close to everything we needed: The conference venue, an easy walk to Chinatown for dining, the Galeries Victoria monorail station nearby for transport to and from some sightseeing and with the close proximity of Town Hall railway station a block or so away, rail transport from the airport was a breeze. The tariff, considering this is the middle of Sydney, was attractive also. Those travellers who really do need room to swing a cat could possibly consider the room a little small but we're in central Sydney; space is at a premium. I believe this establishment has been has been around for about forty years and is starting to show it's age. For example, because of water pressure issues, some technique is needed if one is to enjoy a shower that is at an ambient temperature (No bathtub, so don't look forward to stretching out in a relaxing sea of warm water.). The other age (The building, not me!) related issue is the air conditioning. The advertising says "air conditioning" and whilst there is apparently an ancient evaporative plant somewhere in the building, it is turned off for the winter months and warm air is pumped to the rooms. There is no individual temperature control other than to have it either off or on. We found those two conditions made the room either hot or hotter. The solution was to open the window, put up with the noise of the traffic and risk the rain coming in. If the marketing says "air conditioned" then one's expectation is that it's functioning. Apart from the air-con gripe, Park Regis served our purpose. Clean secure efficiently maintained ensuite accommodation in central Sydney at a reasonable tariff and with courteous and helpful staff. How do I rate it? Somewhat better than three but under four however all things considered, I'd give it 4+ if it was genuinely air conditioned as advertised....

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhollow420
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The location was great! Right in the heart of the city. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that the rooms (at least the one we had) was a little small. There was a Gloria Jeans and Mc Donaldâ€™s right next across the street. DONâ€™T go to the little grocery mart!!! They will rip you off!!! Go to a grocery STORE instead. The hotel is very high, thirty five floors I believe. The roof top was beautiful! There was a pool on the roof. There is also a big laundry facility on the top floor. The Opera House is a little bit of a jaunt. If youâ€™re a runner, itâ€™s a great run! All uphill on the way back. Total, I would estimate about a mile to a mile and a half one way. The staff was accommodating, as we arrived at 8:30 a.m. and check in wasnâ€™t until 3:00 pm, they were able to get us in our room at around 10:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for 3 day special”
Reviews.Author: shona108
Reviews.Content: Nice room with view over Hyde Park and down towards the "Cross" Noise did not worry us on 13th Floor. Great location. Fantastic bed - the biggest and most comfortable of our trip. Excellent bathroom with all sundries. Room needed another light at night - either center of room or another bedside lamp would have helped us oldies. Look forward to our next visit to Park Regis City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Smiley0522
Reviews.Content: We live in Sydney and wanted to stay in the city to watch the soccer world cup at Darling Harbour. Booked this hotel based on price and location, you can walk everywhere, it close to public transport. Room was clean and tidy, bed comfortable. We were on the 11th floor and there was some street noise, nothing unbearable, we always travel with earplugs so that was no problems. Rooftop pool and deck was great, excellent views. Staff were friendly. I could be picky and say the bathroom was slightly on the smaller size and the lighting was not that good for putting make up on, but for the price we paid and the location, to me those are not really big issues. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_and_Biglegs
Reviews.Content: Yes, handy to everything including the Town Hall train station. The Hilton is less than 2 mins walk away, so business people can safely stay here and pretend to be styaing there! Rooms are ... efficient. I had no problems with noise. The views were limited to the car park next door. The door is nice and close to the bed. And the bathroom is just a step away from the bedisde. The rooms are however neat and clean, if a little dispassionate. I noted mostly business people and travelling pensioners staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Glad I Wasn't Paying”
Reviews.Author: Saschi101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Regis City Centre on one of my many work trips to Sydney. My regular accommodation (and most around it) were fully booked, so my employer booked the Park Regis on a recommendation from our corporate travel service. The location is great. It's right in the centre of the city, right near shopping, restaurants and Elix'r gym. That's about the best part of it though. Although the hotel does not bill itself to be five star, it certainly wasn't up to the standard I was expecting. My employer paid almost $300 for a tiny box of a room, which was considerably beneath the standard of the Travelodge down the road. They also gave me a single bed, contrary to the booking request. Although I accept that there was a shortage of accommodation, the hotel was not fully booked and for the price paid, I would have expected better. I've stayed in many hotels, apartments and youth hostels in Sydney and for the price paid, the Park Regis was certainly the worst value. The room fittings were old and to say the room was cosy is being generous. I have no issue with no frills establishments and if the price was under $150, I would not have been as annoyed. But for the price paid, I would have had better facilities at Sydney Central YHA (and had a private with ensuite for considerably less). The staff were friendly and as previously mentioned, the location is perfect, but these were the only positives. The floor was noisy and I could hear conversations in the next room and outside the door. If you want a self-service holiday, the Meriton apartments are considerably better value for money (full kitchen, pay TV and spacious); for a budget stay, I'd recommend the Travelodge (far better fit-out, cheaper and quieter). As I've said, if the room had been $150 or under, I'd have been happy, but for almost double, the accommodation was not up to standard. Unless considerable changes were made, I would not consider the Park Regis for future stays

Reviews.Title: “Great City Location”
Reviews.Author: 76JUK
Reviews.Content: Great City Location - an Easy Walk to Hyde Park, great shops and loads of sight-seeing. Room good value for price. Front Reception Staff Member - younger lady on check-in with dark hair was rude and unpleasant and unhelpful and should not work in tourism/hospitality. All other staff were very friendly and helpful when approached for information. Great City & Hyde Park views from rooftop of Hotel. Will say again as it is such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for business although I think there are probably nicer areas for tourists. I found the rooms very noisy with road noise and lift noise and even after moving rooms it wasnt much better. This is very much a budget hotel but I think the one thing you want from a budget hotel is a good nights sleep and this hotel doesnt offer that.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: dreamseeker13
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Sydney and I went there to attend fashion week. I did email them to double confirm reservation and requested for an early check-in (their check-in time is 2pm while I was arriving at 7am and I needed to attend event at 2pm the same day). I got into the hotel around 9pm and greeting coldly by a young girl and an old man at the reception. He said he couldn't check me in early and asked me to wait until 11am. I went out not knowing where to go but then came back at 11am only to find out that the room wasn't ready. For a second I thought I was treated that way just because I am Asian, but I quickly got rid of that thoughts. In the end, I only managed to check-in by 12.45pm and had to rush to get ready for the event. Throughout 2 nights stay, I found all the staff are just simply arrogant and cold. The room was alright, not as good as I thought from paying a so called "premiere room". It was very tiny, and there was some strange noise coming out of the bathroom, although it didn't bother me much. There is not any safety box inside the room either. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. However, with the same amount of money, perhaps I would have chosen other place. I hope the hotel would improve the service quality, specially with the front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: aworldfoodlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated at the edge of the Hyde Park and at a walking distance to the town centre and Royal Botanic Gardens. The room was spacious, welcoming and very clean with a lovely view onto Hyde Park. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. Very value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: nims
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in total and was a bit apprehensive after reading reviews! Suprisingly was not disappointed. Rooms average size and first 4 nights had room on 9th Floor and overlooking main street so quite noisy during daytime if windows open and last night was on 13th floor so slightly quieter as you go higher! Beds were comfortable but pillows very uncomfortable. Bathroom was basic and Shower was good after figuring out the hot water pressure.Room cleaning was very poor especially bathroom and even after speaking to housekeeping,didn't make a difference! Views from Roof Terrace amazing and had a small pool but very cold water! Some Receptionist staff were very friendly and welcoming especially Anthony and Louis! The location is superb,couple of minutes walk from Town hall station,10-15 mins walk to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour and same to China Town! Monorail stop just across the hotel! McDonalds with McCafe and Jenny's across the road have good breakfast options and convenient if you want early starts! Woolworths down the road was great especially for stocking up on water and snacks as buying these near any tourist sights means paying more than double the prices! They kindly stored our bags for a fee as we were travelling for few days and returning and that was great advantage! Comparing other hotels with perhaps slightly bigger rooms or better facilities,can't beat the price ( if booked on special offer) and location especially as we spent most of the days leaving early and returning late!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula94
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel with an excellent location (just about 10-15 minutes walk from Darling Harbour and from the Sydney Opera House). The room was clean but it was very noisy and my mother found it hard to fall asleep because of the noise but it was Ok for me. The staff were very helpful. I also enjoyed the views from the roof. I definitely recommend it to other travelers and I would certainly go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent option for Sydney downtown”
Reviews.Author: GyW
Reviews.Content: Decent well located hotel. The room was quite modern furnished. Bathroom is very basic and does not match the style and the standard of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: LeeAndBarbK
Reviews.Content: A "businessman's" hotel in the CBD, within walking distance to Darling Harbor and Circular Quay, Park Regis is almost hidden in a middle of the block condo building tucked between several eateries. Our two rooms were plain, clean, and comfortable with small fridges. Great value at an online rate of $84US at the time of booking. 45th floor laundry room @ $3AUD a load allowed us to do a week's worth of laundry after going walkabout to the Rock & Reef before boarding our cruise ship. Spent a total of 3 nights (2 before and 1 after) and the hotel stored our large bags for $5 AUD each while we traveled light for the week. Staff were very helpful and kind. Commonwealth Bank is in the block for ATM and quick/easy currency exchange at very favorable rates. McDonald's is across the street with free WiFi (as are all McD's in Sydney), and the Criterion Pub/Grille several doors down has good food and cold pints. If you've forgotten anything, a multi-floor Woolworth's is a block away. For as expensive as Sydney is, this facility offers excellent value, convenience, and is great for the budget minded traveler. Be sure to do the "Loop"- walk North through Hyde Park to Circular Quay/Rocks, take the ferry around to Darling Harbor, then walk up Park St. to the hotel stopping at Queen Victoria Building to check out all the shops and eateries. Rounding up for bags handled, cab fares are $45-50 from International Terminal, $30-35 to the Domestic Terminal, and $20 to the cruise terminal. If ever back in Sydney, we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very average accomidation”
Reviews.Author: zandraAdelade
Reviews.Content: too noisy need double glazeing on windows rooms to small so are the lifts & reception area it was like a cattle yard at times would never go back you get what you pay for the air con did not work for 5 of the 7 days we were there the bathroom was too small the shower curtain smelt some of the cleaning was not up to standard some of the staff were rude we did get some refund but the hot nights & not much sleep did sour our holliday but i still love sydney

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the down town CBD”
Reviews.Author: APRS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent location in the CBD of Sydney - very close to George Street (QV Centre), within a few minutes of Darling Harbour, Monorail Station (Galleries Victoria Station), Train Station (Town Hall) major department stores (Myers, David Jones). There is no ability to park your vehicle outside the main entrance or near by. Enter their car park off Castlereagh Street (off Park Street) using their intercom to get into the carpark and then book into the hotel. Note its $30 a night for the car (too expensive - but what do you do?) Clean rooms and staff are happy to deal with so no issues there. The big BUT for this hotel is the road noise - its just too loud! Staying on the 10th floor we could hear people from the street! Plus it seems this hotel is on the Emergency Services route to every where in Sydney at least 5-6 Fire, Ambulance or Police siren calls every night! No restaurant/bar but plenty of options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: cardboard_robot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 2 nights in December. The hotel is in a great location, although noisy at night but if you want a hotel so central you need to put up with the noise! We were originally given the wrong room but the reception quickly changed it for us and we got a room on the 8th floor. The pool/deck area was very nice, maybe a bit dirty but the hotel also has dedicated residential floors so not too sure who's responsibility it would be to clean it. The lifts were somewhat scary; if you're going up to the pool area the lift will go up but then if someone at the ground floor presses the lift button it just stops and goes back down to the floor. Took us 20mins to get to the roof one day! The views from the observation area are very nice and the staff are very friendly! We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “painfull lifts”
Reviews.Author: auks
Reviews.Content: Reasonalble sized rooms lots of wear and tear but clean,thin glass quite noisy we were on 6th floor.No fridge.We went 4 couples for our xmas work party wkend ,we all got put on separate floors and the lifts all went to certain floors ,so some times you would wait only for a lift to open and discover it was the wrong one,then wait for another and the same one would come back,very anoying.good location to see the main parts of sydney.Pokey lobby and lift area trying to squeeze past other guests with bags.Plenty of coffee and food within walking distance.Wouldn,t stay here as a family alright for a wkend pissup.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and reasonably priced. Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: SHE9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room, which had a pull out sofa bed and a double. It wasn't huge, but we didn't spend much time there. Our ten and eight year olds slept well on the pull out. The room was clean with a kettle, tea cups, small cartons of milk, wine glasses and fridge. There were two TVs with satelite channels and a small bathroom with a powerful shower. No bath. The pool on the roof was unheated, but the views are amazing. It's very high so it does get windy. The hotel is within walking distance of the Rocks and Circular Quay and the monorail which takes you to Darling Harbour. It is a great base to explore the city and was the cheapest we could find centrally with a family room. We would all recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Loveagreathotel
Reviews.Content: Great location, great views from rooftop pool. Rooms are very average and bathrooms are VERY small. Ok for a night or two but not any longer unless upgrade to a much bigger room. Reception foyer very small. Close to City and right next door to subway, McDonalds, Hungry Jacks etc. Right near Town Hall station for trains and shopping Complex. If rooms were a little bigger, would rate this hotel as excellent. Staff were friendly. Pool area is excellent and would recommend for New Years Eve. Views are incredible and nice area to sit and have a drink at end of day. Would recommend this hotel for a short stay, and if you were not going to spend too much time in your room - just to sleep/shower.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book”
Reviews.Author: Kate222060
Reviews.Content: Very poor management, tiny room outlooking car park, uncomfortable, smells, a bad introduction to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ideal for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Basari57
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here and I found the room adequate for my needs, but I was a solo in a double room so space was no problem !! Basic facilities but everything worked. Despite other reviews I found the reception staff to be very helpful. One small concern would be that the reception desk is right by the access to the lifts and if there are more than 3 people waiting for attention it can get a bit cramped in there with all their luggage. It's worth going to the rooftop to take pictures of the surroundings...good views over Hyde Park. There are no breakfast facilities in the hotel but you are issued with a voucher to eat at a local hotel, and this was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: AdeleP1
Reviews.Content: No hesitations in recommending Park Regis city centre sydney. It's so easy to find just a short walk from Town Hall Station, I got the train here from the airport. The rooms are clean and comfortable with nice views. Can hear some traffic noise, but that's expected in a city. Although the hotel doesn't have 5 star facilities, there is a gym across the road and great walks in the nearby botanical gardens. I've stayed here several times and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ellieNz
Reviews.Content: The price and location is good but its not worth staying there for the very very poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “great location - awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cicada55
Reviews.Content: although it was a warm day the air conditioning was blowing out warm air - staff at the counter didn't give a damn - the room was like an oven and very uncomfortable for sleeping - if you left the window open you got all the sirens and noise from the street (and there was a lot) shower is trianglular shape and very very small

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, no problems”
Reviews.Author: FlyerX
Reviews.Content: Location - great. Close to everything, especially Woolworths and the train station. Bus stops right in front of the building. We were amazed at how accessible it is to just about anything. Staff - friendly. Allowed us to check in a few hours early after a very long flight. Personally I do not like to be accosted by hotel staff whenever I come through the doors, so I was not bothered by not being greeted every time I walked past the front desk like a reviewer below. I found the staff to be courteous and helpful. Room - perfect size for two of us. Bed was very comfortable, and decor was cute. Internet access is pricey, but it is offered both in the room or at the kiosk by the front desk. Go across the street to McDonalds, buy a coffee and use theirs for free. The weather was too cold for us to even dip a toe into the pool, but I imagine that in the summer it would be convenient to dip in to cool off. The roof top lounge was a nice touch as well. We were only here two nights but would have stayed longer if we were in Sydney longer. A few of the other reviews mentioned noise at night and we did not have a problem at all. We only heard the occasional swoosh of traffic and Sydney drivers don't seem to lean on the horn as some American drivers do in large cities I've stayed in. We were on the tenth floor and it was ample cushion to muffle any street sounds.

Reviews.Title: “was a good exprince”
Reviews.Author: Teckhamster
Reviews.Content: was a good hotel to stay at staff are very nice show me around the city and show me place to go and the night clubs let me check in at 9pm which was really nice and early after a very early qantas flight i would recommand to anyone on a buget an like to stay in the city good service and the view from the roof was the best i seen from all the hotels i have been to A+.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- Horrible customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: maria414
Reviews.Content: went to sydney australia for 10 days this past july-august and was very surprised to see that the front desk hosts were not so hospitable-almost racist like. Having worked as a waitress for three years communication and keeping guests happy is the way to be. Unfortunately not once was I greeted good morning or how may I help you while entering and exiting the hotel (and mind you they weren't doing anything just talking amongst each other). I have to make a special mention to the name Louis- who treated my boyfriend and I with such disrespect that if it werent for the great location of the hotel, we probably would have left. He not once greet us BUT he had time to acknowledge some French tourists who were leaving the hotel a "bonjour" and even had time to converse. Another incident with Louis was when my boyfriend didn't have a key since they only gave us one and I had the key since I was upstairs doing laundry. My boyfriend asked if there was a way that they can have him go up to our room. Louis replied that he can take the stairs but that would be 45 floors (since that's where the laundry room was) in a sarcastic and serious manner. There was another girl (Caucasian lady dark brown-red haired) that was with him and she gave him an attitude as well. Ultimately my boyfriend gave them an attitude (at this point we had been staying at the hotel for a week and have been seeing these front desk attendants daily!) and they proceeded to let him up. Unfortunately I do not have the name of the other one two that I am complaining about ( think the other man was John). We wanted to book two tours from the same company for the Blue Mountains and the Wine Tasting tour and had previously asked another host to book it for us. John (whom I will call by this name, he worked the afternoon shift until I think 10 or 11pm) , when asked to book it for us, looked at me in a funny manner and stated with a look on his face that was surprised by my question and a look that said "You're crazy if you think that", answered to me "We do not do that." I then noted that I was surprised hotel front desk doesn't do that as I would think it would be part of their job description or if not, they can perform such act as a sign of courtesy and I know that having worked in some form of customer satisfaction industry. He then asked if I worked in the industry with now a smile and actually trying to be nice. I replied that as guests of the hotel that it would be nice for them if they did and didn't answer his initial question. He then proceeded to call the company and booked for us the two tours. Ever since then he was nothing but nice to us when we approached him-though all of the front desk personnel never really greeted us. Overall the trip was good. hotel? Not so good. 2.5 star. Ultimately, I would recommend the location- it is very close to Darling Harbor and China town (10min walk) Circular Quays (if you ilke to walk is about 20 mins) and very near convenient stores. Woolworhs grocery store is only a block away. Across the street is a McDonalds that has free WI-FI so don't bother using the hotel one. Look at my review for what amenities the hotel has, which is very few. NO: restaurant, room service, good service at all, air conditioning when its hot during the afternoon so they open the windows to let cool air in.. how cheap. HAVE: good view of the the city, pool (not cleaned because it is the winter) Good for the value we paid. I apologize for no pictures since I figured there's no need for it because there's nothing extravagant or beautiful about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for $$, but could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: cesarhanke
Reviews.Content: I stay at Park Regis all the time when on my business trips to Sydney. It had a top location that is hard to beat for those like me are on business in Sydney and have to make the most of time. I just wished the room and bathroom was cleaner and perhaps better beds.... but it is ok for the price you pay. Tip 1 - AVOID rooms ending on 01 (eg, 701) they are way too small. Tip 2 - have a look at the swimming pool at the top floor... really nice views from there!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Service for average hotel - is that executive or standard?”
Reviews.Author: ksar1901
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a central Sydney hotel then this is it. The location and walking distance to the park, Town Hall train station and shops is brilliant. On the down side - I paid for an executive suite but it looks like I was given a standard room - there was nothing "executive" about my room except the price. Pity, because when I booked there were no standard roms left. Upon asking, I was told it was executive - the hotel pictures on the wall show otherwise?? The hotel staff were not necessarily rude, but hopeless in terms of knowing the ins and outs of their hotel and were slow in their service. The rooms? clean but small with basic facilities. I would recommend - if only for the location and the promise of a "standard" room.

Reviews.Title: “Why not”
Reviews.Author: crazyHobart
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 2 nights back in 2005 on the 10th floor and yes we do agree with other people about road and people noise we also realised we were staying in the middle of a large city .Having said that i could see some improvement is needed to mend the problem . If you are looking for somewhere to be pampered and to have all the facilities at your call then dont stay here but if you need a base to leave from then you are at the right place very central to most facilities food,sightseeing monorail ,Aquarium,Maritime Museum,Paddys Market, Quay and of course shopping then this could be very well the place to stay and yes I would stay here again and I would recommend it to my friends with a slight warning about the noise

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Sydney after an overnight flight from Perth, and were able to check-in early (around 10am) at the Park Regis with no problems. Located only a block away from the subway, and close to shops. There is a 24 hour convenience store and taxi stand across the street. The rooftop deck has a great view, and the laundry room also has some great views. Small, basic room, but it had cable tv and a small mini-fridge. The only odd thing about the hotel is that is located in the same building as privately owned condos/apartment, so you end up sharing the elevators, roof deck, and laundry room with full-time residents in the building. Wasn't a problem at all, just a little different. And one elevator doesn't go up to the top floor, which can be a little confusing until you figure out which one to get on. Overall, good value for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, value for money”
Reviews.Author: kerway25
Reviews.Content: A group of us were booked into this hotel by a friend in Sydney and when we went on line and read the reviews we were apprehensive. Getting a good nights sleep is one of the main things you look for in a hotel. Some of us were staying 10 nights and some were sharing 3 to a room. The rooms are small but certainly okay for a couple. Definitely not okay for 3 sharing for 10 nights - easy answer - we upgraded to an executive suite. It was not much dearer and meant we had more room and a nice decor. Would definitely ask for an upgrade at this hotel on my next visit. Our friend who was sharing with us got bad news on our first day and had to get to Brisbane urgently. The staff organised everything for her, getting her flight information so she had a couple of times to choose from and then booking the flight. It was left open for her to come back to the hotel as and when she could. They could not have been more helpful. The location was perfect, everything we wanted to get to in less than 30 minutes (my slow walking speed) walk away - Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour, Opera House and botanical gardens, Kings Cross, monorail and train station. The reception was 24 hours and the taxi stand opposite the same. Lots of eateries all around including McDonalds and Hungry Jack across the road, clubs like the Catholic Club wich serve good meals for a reasonable price, the pub next door which serves big meals with lots of chips, again for a good price, the coffee bar downstairs a good breakfast and great coffee, Gloria Jeans opposite on one corner and Starbuck opposite in the other direction. Being on a main street did mean there was noise throughout the night. Upgrading gave us double glazing in our bedroom but the lounge, where our friend slept, and which faced out on to the main street, did not have double glazing and she slept with the window partly open and did not find it difficult to sleep. We had brought ear plugs with us but did not need them. Other friends staying 10 nights stayed in the ordinary room and had no problems. All in all a pleasant stay, my husband enjoyed the free lollies in the lolly jar on the desk in reception, the staff were pleasant and knowledgeable and the room was nicely cleaned everyday. We are going to make the most of visiting again for long weekends when we can get good flights.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Roamingx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Sydney on business and, despite having tried others since finding the Park Regis a couple of years ago, I keep coming back. It's well located, the rooms are modern, stylish, and comfortable, everything always works, and it's fully reliable. I don't mind the noise and I appreciate windows that open, only a two block walk to the train and Hyde Park. I've paid between $100 and $140 depending on season and availability and consider this well-priced in the market for the room quality and convenient location. Beware that they'll nickel-and-time you: $2 to store each piece of luggage after checkout and a surcharge of 1.5% for Visa and M/C and 3.5% for AMEX and Discover, but 24 hours of Internet is fast and reasonable at $16.50 without usage restrictions. I'll keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Prison cell”
Reviews.Author: aussieroos
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel becos of its location and price. It turned out to be very basic (like a YMCA basic). If I could turn back the clock, I'd definitely pay a little more and stay elsewhere. The receptionists were worth mentioning - as I have never seen any that rude. A few times I said Hello and Good Morning as I walked past, they either did not respond, or simply looked down and pretended to be looking at the PC screen. Incredible! My room was on the 15th floor, very small and has hardly any furniture. The walls were thin. The cushion on the bed has a strong smell of greasy hair. The shower is also tiny, I hit my elbows a few times at the faucet and I am only petite! The wash basin is also tiny and you cannot wash your face without wetting the floor. In short, the room felt like a prison cell. After the stay at Park Regis City Centre, I moved to the Four Points Sheraton and the hotels are worlds apart. I should have stayed at Four Points all along altho the location is not as good.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: LotsaBlondeMoments
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights 26-28th March. Staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were adequate, clean and beds comfortable. Perfect location in the city and so close to the underground and monorails. Traffic noise wasnt a problem even tho we were on the roadside (11th floor). Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kyliedbu
Reviews.Content: For a great centrally located city hotel the Park Regis is the best value for money. Our room was tastefully furnished, fully renovated and spotless. Not a bad size too! If you are after a great city room with no frills this place is perfect. Their is a pool area on the roof that is a little shabby but great views. Only bad points I can think of is the basic small reception and the noise from the street below as the windows open and are not soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: Laure38
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights there, and this is a place I would definitely not recommend. The place is extrememly noisy (could not sleep), the romm small and the staff was rude and unable to (or unwilling to) help. The hotel is clean and well-situated. There are other places in Sydney at the same price, with comfortable, quiet rooms and nice and smiling staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent!!”
Reviews.Author: Bazzog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at Park Regis prior to New Year. Pretty much what we expected in terms of quality as we were travelling through the country on a budget.. For exploring the main sites in Sydney the hotel is well positioned about 5-10 minute walk from Darling Harbour and Circular.. The room size is adequate with bathroom and shower efficent but prob would need a little more space. Staff were fine and rooms were clean!!

Reviews.Title: “We had to leave because of the noise”
Reviews.Author: kiwidive
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights booked at the Park Regis and should have read the reviews here first - the traffic noise was so bad it kept us awake and we were on the 7th floor!! We could hear the pedestrian crossing go off every few minutes it was a nightmare. Our room also stunk of stale cigarettes despite it being a non-smoking floor. The only reason I am giving this 2 stars instead of 1 is because we were given a full refund on the remaining 3 nights we had prepaid. Apparently they get that all the time...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not particuarly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Pepper02Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Regis for 6 nights and found the hotel to be suitable for what we wanted. It is ideally located for both circular quay and darling harbour, both about 10ish minutes walk away. The room we had was small but as we were literally only there to sleep it didnt really matter. Everything worked and the bed was comfy. The shower was a bit tempremental when it came to giving us hot water but turning it off and on again seemed to sort that out. The bathroom was tiny but it was clean so it didnt really matter. The one thing that lets this hotel down the most is the fact that it is situated on a really busy road. This didnt keep us awake or prevent us from sleeping on week nights (but i would imagine that if you are a light sleeper you would suffer) but on Saturday night it would appear that Sydneyers don't sleep and the noise levels from the street are much worse. I would advise taking ear plugs with you if you are staying there over a friday or saturday night or you're a light sleeper in general. The reception has internet access and has plenty of tourist brochures. Pitt Street is just round the corner for shopping, and Woolies and Coles are down the road for your bits and bobs like water etc. The nearest train station is Town Hall (the airport link train stops here) and its approx 5mins if that walk from hotel. Darling Harbour and Circular Quay have plenty of places to eat and are worth visiting a night to see them lit up. All in all we enjoyed our stay in Sydney and the Park Regis, for what we paid, was adequate enough for what we needed (which was a bed and shower!!). If your not after luxury and just want a basic hotel I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Hoggman
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel well located in the city. Not a good hotel to sit back and relax in. The pool has no furniture and if you need to use the toilet while chilling on the observation deck you need to make your way back via the very slow lifts to your room as reception won't give you a key for the ob deck toilets. Best not to have a car with you as the extremely small carpark is very scary. The bathroom was very small with hardly even anywhere to place your toiletries bag! Free to air TV only. Outside noise not very well insulated. Upon check out we were told about addtional phone charges that we refused to pay as we hadn't made any. The receptionist conceded that they had had trouble with the phones. I would say that this hotel would be best suited to a one/two night stay for those using public transport and not spending much time on the premises. Reasonably priced. Staff could have been a little more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: d_nomad
Reviews.Content: Park Regis is a comfortable multistorey hotel bang in the centre of town. a short walk to darling harbour and Hyde park. We loved our stay here! The hotel was clean and safe. The room was a bit small, but had everything to make our stay comfortable. There is a rooftop swimming pool which gave brilliant views to the city! The staff were friendly and helpful, and it was really easy getting transport from and to the airport - we got doorstep drop and pickup in a share van. The place is not basking in luxury for those who are looking for it - but still is a nice comfortable stay for the common traveller.

Reviews.Title: “good location, not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: local-visit
Reviews.Content: We checked in for the weekend and although the location is ok the room was too small, the bathrooms were very small, the taps did not work properly and when we spoke to the staff about the problem found the staff to be very rude. We also noticed that some of the staff did not speak very good english. Having said that the staff were helpful when it came to ordering a cab. It appears that some staff were very effiecent and helpful while others couldn't care less. The bed was lumpy and the beds/room were not made until late the second night. Overall, the hotel was ok for a short stay and for those who do not stay in the hotel too much. Considering there are several other hotels nearby we would not recomend this hotel or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location & comfy room”
Reviews.Author: morningtea
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Night here & found the room quite comfy & all we needed for a night. Settled our account on arrival after receiving our room key. I told the Receptionist we hadn't paid & she said oh thanks for telling me. Not long after occupying our room received a phone call from Reception asking us if we had paid our account. I inadvertently left a almost new item of clothing behind on departure & phoned when I got home. Housekeeping had found it & it was to be sent to me C.O.D. After a few days I phoned again saying I would call in a couple of days & collect it but was told it was no longer there. Almost a month later I still have not received it so guess they threw it out after saying they would forward it to me. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Alright. No Fancy, No Fuss.”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Park Regis, I thought it was kinda backpacker hotel with such tiny lobby. But thank God, the receptionist was kind enough to provide me the room earlier around 9am as I arrived there. Room is not so big, pretty adequate for couples. Bathroom is alright. No bathtubs, nothing fancy. Just a common bathroom. Not much amenities provided so make sure you bring your things. Bed is quite alright, I have good sleep during my stay. No fuss. I got a room facing the main street. It was great. The traffic noise is not as bad as I thought it would be. So just make sure you get a high floor rooms. Mine was at the 13th floor and it was ok. I didnt have problem with weekend or weekday traffic noise thingy during my stay. Receptionists are pretty alright. Nothing much. Just ok. Location is great. Nearby the town hall station. short stroll to woolworth and qvb. It's pretty centralized so you dont have to worry about the location. Don't expect something big or fancy in this hotel. Just adequate. No fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service & great location!”
Reviews.Author: jilliz
Reviews.Content: It's funny how people's impressions can be so vastly different because I thought the Park Regis was great. It's a 3 star so on that basis I was really pleased. The reception staff were all very friendly and helpful, the room was a good size (small bathroom as mentioned in other reviews, but nicely presented and I didn't need much space to wash in!). Ironing board in the room which was essential when living out of a suitcase. The whole room was clean and modern and definitely at the top end of the many 3* hotels I've stayed in. The hotel staff were really accommodating when I arrived at 10am desperate to go to bed (jet-lag!) and let me check in early. I didn't have a problem with the street noise despite sleeping with the window open; it depends on your tolerance level but I found it added to the city atmosphere without preventing me sleeping. Location is brilliant, walking distance to everything in the CBD as well as Darling Harbour. Close to two stations (Town Hall & Museum) and Hyde Park. Starbucks, McDonalds, a pizza place and a pub all within 100m of the hotel, plus Woolworths was 2 minutes away which sold most things as well as having internet access. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Park Regis again next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi Bloke
Reviews.Content: Had a great 9 night stay at the Park Regis Hotel Sydney. Good staff, great location 1 min walk to Town Hall station, across the road to the Museum Station, taxi rank outside the hotel. Heaps of eating places within 5 mins walk. Only problem is the traffic noise, which on Fri & Sat can be quite noisey, the back rooms are a lot quieter than the road facing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple and central â€“ good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: SThom_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Regis mainly due to its location and price (cost $145AUS). This place had a nice fresh entry foyer and pleasant (but basic) staff. They stuffed my entry card up on the second day but fixed it straight away â€“ no real apology though (their communication with me was brief at best). The room was an ok size, had pretty nice furnishings including a flat screen TV and decent size desk, and an opening window (becoming rare to find)! The bathroom was an odd shape and quite small â€“ but in good condition. The view from the 10th floor was of a/c units on roofs â€“ but it was in the CBD mind you. The cleaning staff were quite friendly and seemed to do a good job. Other reviews have mentioned the noise â€“ there is a surprising amount of noise coming from the busy street below. I suggest earplugs if youâ€™re a light sleeper. It was overall good value for money with a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lina3
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were staying there 4 nights last month,we found it very clean and tidy, friendly and helpful staff. The location is very good situated near HYde park and 15 minutes walk from Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. A fabulous view from the 45th stairs where the pool is situated. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: HillsBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night. I was visiting a friend who was staying in Sydney for a few days and I wasn't too bothered about where I stayed as long as it was central. The room cost A$140 for the night. It was on the 11th floor and the room was a decent size for the price - large bed, LCD TV (only standard channels though), clean, good decor and looked recently renovated. Only a couple of blocks from Town Hall train station. Decent view. Quite a bit of road noise though, but you are right in the center of Sydney. Checkin/out was straightforward and the staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Smurfette25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and it was fantastic. When I arrived I was taken up to my room (booked a double) and found out it was actually 2 singles pushed together. I asked to be moved but was told that they had given me an upgrade because I was staying the 4 nights. The receptionist was great and offered to show me the room I should have had. When I saw it I was glad to have the other room, this one was half the size with the bed pushed up against the wall and not much room to swing a cat. The room they had given me was double the size with plenty of room, very comfy bed and a good view over the QVB. The bathroom wasn't very big but that didn't matter. It's a great central location within walking distance to Hyde Park, Sydney Tower, QVB and a bit longer walk to The Rocks, Circular Quay, the Bridge and Opera House. Staff were very friendly and helpful so I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good...”
Reviews.Author: Kaf77
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find out that my booking (made through their website) for a twin room was AWOL and the hotel was 'full'. My friend and I were offered a room elsewhere as the hotel was supposedly booked out, but the choices were pretty poor, so they tried to give us a standard room with one double bed. I love my friend to bits but didn't want to share a tiny bed with her so I complained, saying this isn't what I booked or paid for, and after an hour or so, a room with two single beds suddenly became available...why this wasn't offered in the first place is a mystery. The room was fine for its class but we couldn't figure out the aircon so we pretty much melted. Will definitely not be back.... they probably wouldn't even have my reservation to begin with!!!!

Reviews.Title: “practical and central”
Reviews.Author: travelexpress
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times because I like the location and the price is reflected in this. The hotel is very basic but clean. There is no in house restaurant but vouchers are awarded for breakfast as the nearby coffee house. Our original allocated room was very small but once we explained we were staying for over a week, a more suitable room was made available for us. Would recommend as a stop over hotel but not for a 2 week stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, But can be noisy at weekends”
Reviews.Author: RoyPartington
Reviews.Content: I can be contacted regarding any of my hotel - location reviews. If your visiting the east coast of Australia click on my profile to see other hotels we visited. The Park Regis is in a fantastic location for being central to most of the tourist attractions, However it can suffer from the fact that there is no double glazing and at weekends the noise from the people coming out of the bars is clearly audiable, I read the previous reviews mentioning this and thought probably the same as what you are thinking now while reading this, "no surely you cant here people talking in the street when your in your bedroom on the 11th floor with all the windows closed and air conditioning turned on" Trust me you certainly can here them, the police sirens ambulances etc as well seem to go on until 3am. Having said that the I had some ear plugs which cut out the noise and also if you have a good drink you wont here it or if your a heavy sleeper. We did notice that it was only fri and sat nites mind you, and if it had being really really bad I would of moved us to another hotel, but it all depends on how easy you can get to sleep I guess as we are all differant. In terms of the room, we have 2 children aged 9 and 13 and we had a 1 bed room room with fold out bed in the lounge. No problems at all with the cleanliness of the room or hotel what so ever. I noticed others on trip advisor complain about the size of the bathroom, well I dont know how much room you need to shower or sit on the toilet but as far as we were concerned yet again no problems what so ever. The rooms had every thing we needed there was plenty of room it was clean modern apart from no double glazing it could'nt be faulted, depends on whether you want to trade off the fri-sat noise for the fantastic location. There is a swimming pool on the roof, floor 45, and I think its from floor 15 up over that its owned by local residents in induvidual apartments ie locals living in sydney, the hotel only owns from 14 downover. And you can most definately use the pool with the locals up on the top floor, cant comment on that as we were too busy to use the pool. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. For local directions etc Turn left out of the hotel and walk straight down Park st for approx 10 mins or so past the monorail and you will come to darling harbour, or simply grab the monorail which you can jump on and off all day long once you pay. For the Harbour Bridge and Opera house, Turn left out of the hotel, take the 1st right onto Pitt St and keep walking straight down approx 10 mins or so and you will come to Circular Quay and the Bridge area where all the ferries are and the Opera House, Check out the Manly ferry and Manly beach its better than Bondi beach after getting off the manly ferry just walk straight across the road down the pedestrianized zone and you will come to the actual beach, most people think the beach either side of the ferry at manly is the correct manly beach its not, walk through the shopping area opposite the ferry terminal. For that Spectacular Family Photo with the Opera House behind you and the Sydney Harbour Bridge behind the Opera house all in the same shot, you need to go to Mrs Macquaries Chair, as you look at the opera house in front of you its the green park over to your right and you can easily walk round to it, There are professional photographers there up the top section who for $10AUD will print you out a professional photo taken by them so you know you are getting that once in a lifetime moment captured professionally, get them to copy it to CD or onto your own cameras memory card so you can print it yourself and email it later I asked them and they gladly put my cameras memory card into there laptop and copied the photo they had just taken of us to my cameras memory card which was great as I can now get it printed out at differant sizes etc and framed. Families We found families are catered for well in sydney with regard to eating and drinking, however on the night time unless you are having a meal its pretty hard to simply walk in with the kids for a drink so simply walk in and ask for chips or something small and grab yourself a drink, APART FROM the Darling Harbour area where there was no problem, they have differant rules in darling harbour for kids as its the main tourist area but you still had to be out by 10pm at the latest with Kids, APART FROM the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel, pyrmontbridgehotel.com which we found to be the closest to an english pub in the central CBD area. Also use Google earth to see just how close Hotels etc are to the centre of towns/cities you are visiting, we found it to be invaluable in making sure we were not stuck in the middle of no where. If your visiting the east coast of Australia click on my profile to see other hotels we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, windows need soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: MatronLumb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for location, central Sydney amongst the shops. 10 minute walk to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the Opera House. Has top floor roof with pool with fab views. Rooms small but modern, clean and tastefully decorated. Only issue for this not to be excellent for the price was that the windows were not soundproof so you could hear the sounds of the city even though we were 13 floors up. If this doesn't bother you its a`great place for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: dazman69
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Park Regis Sydney. For the most expensive city in Australia for accommodation, this hotel is very good value for money. The rooms are newly refurbished with modern decor including flat screen LCD televisions. The location is central to everything this great city has to offer; pretty much everything is within walking distance. One note that I must agree on, is the rooms do pick up a lot of the outside road noise, so if you are a light sleeper, bring some ear plugs. Apart from check-in and check-out I didn't have any need to talk to the staff so I can't comment on that aspect. I found the big bowl of mints at reception a very nice touch! If outside noise is not an issue (and it is not that bad as suggested), this is a very modern, cheap and central hotel in Sydney and I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are rude!”
Reviews.Author: hez7
Reviews.Content: The location is good - but a few of the staff were rude, one of the guys said he didnt like us. My friend fell on the stares at reception and they couldnt care less. She required stiches etc and when they were told they couldnt even offer her some proper first aide. As for the place? Small, and the shower taps are ridiculous. The rooms are very dusty! The pool is like a pond. Dont reccomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy at best”
Reviews.Author: roddyBcCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights because it was located close to everything and only 2 blocks to the Town Hall train station and in our price range. We booked their "Spring Fever" special that gave us a King size bed and free "breakfast" and a noon check out time. When we checked in, we noticed that the 2 breakfast packs were on the dresser. They each consisted of a small box of cereal, a small carton of milk, a cereal bar, bowl, spoon, sugar and a small carton of orange juice. The hotel sells these for A$7.95 each - glad we were getting them no charge. The next day when we returned to the hotel, there was only one pack on the dresser, and I had to let the people know that we needed a total of two. The staff, although trying to be helpful, did not have a great command of the English language. I finally got across to them that there should be two breakfast packs each day. They still never got it right until our last day. Be wary of their internet description. It says there are free daily newspapers at the front desk, but when I tried to take a paper, the staff person told me I had to pay for it, and the only free paper was the weekly one. I told him what it said on the internet and he rudely pointed out to me that he had been there 6 years and the papers were never free. Their hotel booklet states that there is a discount for guests that eat in the cafe next door. When we went there for dinner and showed the waiter our hotel key, he said the discount is for breakfast only! The bathroom is VERY VERY small. The hot water comes from an under-sink canister that can only provide a small amount of hot water at a time, so it is very hard to have a shower, without almost scalding yourself and then freezing. VERY dangerous! There was only one night table and one table lamp, but the room itself certainly had room for another night table. The closet was a stand-alone unit and very very small. There were two dinette style chairs in the room, so it was very uncomfortable to sit in the room to watch tv. The ceiling light was very dim. There was a flourescent fixture over the bathroom sink but it had a sticker on it saying it was temporarily disconnected. When I asked the clerk about our check out time she said 10 a.m. I suggested that she look up our reservation and when she did, she said it was 12 noon! I would not stay here again. This is not a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Unreal Noise All Day and Night.”
Reviews.Author: trumby
Reviews.Content: Great location to SYDNEY CBD But the NOISE IS SHOCKING DAY AND NIGHT,no diffrent if you shut the window and pull the curtains.LIFTS were a long wait plus 2 of the 3 days the hotel lift was not working,CHARGE for baggage storage was odd. AIR CON control was not working properly,and it took 10 minutes each time you had a shower to get the water temp right. LIGHTING in room very poor for reading or doing things,down lights just for mood lighting.

Reviews.Title: “free upgrade from a hot reception guy”
Reviews.Author: biccy
Reviews.Content: Hi all, my boyfriend and I chose to stay here 1 Saturday night, mainly for its close location to the Town Hall train station, monorail, and Chinatown. We booked a standard Studio for AU$129. The reception staff were super friendly. We were allowed to check-in at 9am instead of 2pm. I jokingly asked for a free upgrade, since it was my birthday the next day, and suprisingly the young reception guy did not hesitate at all! He gave us a "slightly larger" room worth AU$179. *THANKS MATE!* Although big enough for 2 people, the room wasn't that big, so it makes me wonder how small the original room would've been. We were on 7th floor with a view of Park St, which wasn't that great since we weren't very high up... However it was very nicely furnished, with a small widescreen TV in front of the bed. As for the bathroom, it was PUNY. The toilet was only a feet away from the shower CURTAINS. Showering was ok but very squashy, and water leaked onto the whole bathroom floor. Sleeping was a nightmare - probably coz we were on the 7th floor facing the street, and it was a Saturday night. But I did an allnighter the night before! And the bed was comfy! So I thought I would be easily knocked out from 36hrs without sleep!!! >=( .. I woke up so many times during the night, but then at 5am I turned on the radio and managed to sleep til 9am without hassle. Oh, and it costs $20 for every hour after check-out so beware. For some reason the clock in the hotel room was half an hour fast, which we didn't realise til we went to stay at another hotel hehe All in all, I would stay at this hotel again, for its location and price. Next time I will remember to ask for a higher room, not facing the street. Ooo! And the reception guy was the nicest guy I met in Sydney - excellent service - not bad looking either =D~ hehe

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ricklangley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the Park Regis en route home from NZ. The best thing is the location, about five minutes walk from Town Hall MTR station and close to George Street for shopping and buses to Circular Quay. I was fortunate to have a room which didn't directly overlook the street, so was pretty quiet. The room and bathroom were small, but very nicely furnished. I didn't discover the rooftop pool until the morning I checked out, but it looked inviting and the views were excellent. The hotel has no facilities as such, not even a coffee shop, so you have to go out for everything, but given the proximity of shops and cafes etc. this was not a problem. Excellent value for money for such a central location. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location but take the ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: RobertMcNab
Reviews.Content: A great Location. with a Monorail stop nearby Buses on next cross street to take you to circular Quay . The Hotel is very clean. There's a a pool and and relaxation area on the roof (45th floor) Its a bit on the noisy side especially with Police and ambulance sirens through the night. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but look elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: 2traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Park Regis after much contemplation. Booked in a Premier King room which is the best room offered. On check-in, was advise that there was no Premier King room available and we would have to take the Twin room. After flying for 10 hours to get to Sydney with my partner, this was not appreciated! Finally, after much discussion, a Premier King room became available. The room itself is quite nicely finished for a 3 star property - modern and fresh. The biggest problem is the noise from outside. Single glazed windows means that even on the 10th floor, you are awaken multiple times throughout the night by street noise - people, vehicles, sirens, and the rest. The other problem we had is that on the 3rd night, we left the room at 1pm. Apparently housekeeping had finished for the day, so they left fresh towels outside the room in a plastic bag for us! Not very professional at all. The staff at the hotel are a bit of a mixed bag. Biggest complaint I have is that the staff should remember they are working at a 3 star hotel, hot a 5 star one! Attitudes are sometimes not very friendly, and on check-out, we had to pay $2 to store each bag for a few hours. I have never had to pay to store my bag at any other hotel and after spending $700 at the hotel, I was fairly unhappy having to pay $4 to keep two bags there for a few hours! Honestly, I would probably look elsewhere before choosing the Park Regis. Yes, the location is great, but the trade-offs are not worth it. I will certainly never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sharose
Reviews.Content: Hi all , If your looking for something central to everything in the city eg. shopping, monorail, buses, entertainment this is the place to be. They don't do meals but hey sydney is bursting with great places to eat... if your budget conscious .. there is Mac Donalds and Hungry Jacks across the road, cafe next door, great pub meals down the road or hop the monorail to china town. The Staff are really great ... always willing to help.. they also have great local knowledge to help get you where your going.. This place is value for money.. We will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MansfieldSunseekers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Our room was extremely clean and a fair size for 2 people with a very confortable king size bed although it has to be said we did upgrade to a superior room. True there was some noise at night from the street below ( we were on the 9th floor) although after tiring days around the sights of Sydney it did not keep us awake. Our room was recently refurbished and this has been done to a very high standard, flat screen TV, tea and coffee and all toiletries provided. The staff on reception were very helpful at all times, however I would have liked a safety deposit box in my room and not on the Reception desk. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will definately stay here again. We did not have any meals in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Marred by Traffic Noise”
Reviews.Author: gzsue
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice rooms. Good value. Except......I have never encountered such noise from outside traffic. The windows were closed and still you could clearly hear an incredible amount and detail of noise. We bookended our holiday at this hotel. After our first stay on the 13th floor and enough noise to be uncomfortable for sleeping, we requested a quieter room for our return stay. We were rewarded with a room on the 7th floor, on the corner, which made it impossible to sleep. We could even hear pedestrians laughing!! I would say that this issue completely turned us off the hotel. Unless you are not bothered by noise, give this hotel a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uncleaned hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingaround2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2006 and can't say this is a good hotel. However, the location is perfect. Upon arrival, they provided a non-smoking room, which smells like someone just smoke before we entered the room. I talked to reception they only offered to spray the room. Being asmathic, the spray will not do the trick... At the same time, the room was dusty and during the 5 days we stayed, housekeeping didn't cleaned the room. They just exchanged towels, fixed the beds, and wiped bathroom floors... The bathrooms are really small which made me feel like I was staying in a hostel paying USD$15 for a room. Some of the staff have this negative attitude... like you stayed there for free... (I guess this is what happens when you book the hotel through an agent) They don't help you and they feel unease when you ask them for help... I think there are better options in the same area or at least cheaper... Try to avoid this overprice "hostel" as much as you can...

Reviews.Title: “CBD Sydney has no better value”
Reviews.Author: Patrick44
Reviews.Content: The location, the courtesy of desk staff and the fair price sum up this hotels virtues. Sure the bathroom was a little small but it was modern and functional. We found it a wonderful city centre base and would gladly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: BG007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Regis for several nights recently and were in general happy with our choice. It needs to be said that this hotel is 3 stars, so donâ€™t expect anything fancy. First time we went up to our room we thought we mistakenly took the service elevator. The location is excellent, walking distance from all CBD attractions and only a couple of minutes walk from two train stations with trains going to Circular Quay and Bondi Junction. There is also a supermarket one block away. Staff is a mixed bag. Some were helpful and friendly; others were, well, not as nice or so well informed. Our room was good enough, new and clean, but as noted by previous reviewers, noise is a problem. We were given what we were told was the most quiet room in the hotel, still street noise was definitely an issue, especially during the weekend. While on an absolute scale the Park Regis is not a great find, it seems to be a good choice in Sydney for the price we paid (A$140 per night) and we will definitely consider it again next time weâ€™re fortunate enough to visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money - Centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mmdownunder
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had a recent renovation new beds/paint/furniture etc. I have stayed at this hotel many times both before and after the renovations and I havent changed my mind about it. You cant beat for location and value when booked thru wotif. It is located smack bang in the middle of Sydney with the QVB, Woolworths supermarket, plenty of food, transport bus, rail,monorail and taxis at the door. Not to mention easy walking distance to everything! The rooms are a good size all with new bathrooms and windows that open, it can be noisey at the front of hotel but that is the price you pay for a view and the busy city outside. I stay here regulary and the staff are always pleasant and helpful . If you are looking for a nice meal good steaks and vegys and a cold beer try the Mezz Restaurant upstairs in the Cornation Hotel about 150 yards down the street towards Town Hall. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Truckman-Mick
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Australia, and I couldn't have picked a better hotel. It is central and close to all amenities. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull. The room was excellent, with TV, coffee/Tea making facillities and an excellent view of Park Street. The Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Circular Quays are only a 30 minute walk from the hotel. The location couldn't be better. I would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Regis City Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 27 Park Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
